4lWnLmNdW3mAOIMgxqqyPA.review_text: I go here for the Boddington's. They know how to pour them. I've been tempted by the wine list on occasion, but have never faltered. Stay the course!  Very comfortable and down to earth place nestled in amongst the boutiques and galleries of Hayes Valley. One of the friendliest bars in SF. I only miss the dart board.

k3mYPM2ek4if5bvsP7q8LQ.review_text: Its nice that my local neighborhood bar has such delicious beers (decent assortment of local/regional microbrews, plus the standbys of fat tire and chimay and guinness and such), and plays such good music (usually high-quality upbeat hip hop, not the dancing type but the chilling and nodding your head type).   And now its smoke-free!

cvcxw3BFhcotP9lSF_xHVg.review_text: Now here's a nice little bar on Hayes St -- very mellow and chill, with enough chairs and couches to make lounging extremely accessible for all. It's beer and wine only but there's a good selection on tap, and you can always... uh... pregame it somewhere else.  There also have foosball table in back, but you gotta bring your quarters -- and your game.

rMNPcAVo5Jpm55Sm68eQ2Q.review_text: It's a dive and kick back local hang out.  No frills kinda place.

WI9UJah3bVB258wzEIh34A.review_text: I just can't respect a bar that doesn't serve vodka.  That and it smells like a foot inside this bar.  Me not likey.

qUg4PXAT42bxV48CqPaUwQ.review_text: Chimay, Hoegaarden, dog friendly (You'd think it was Rocket Dog here), people friendly.  Who could ask for anything more? But wait there's more. Pool table and Foosball table. Yeah Baby. Friendly bartender who offers liquid refreshment advice and great conversation. Joint seems to be jumping any night of the week. Tuesday is the new Friday at Pigalle.

XbxaaX2uwi84gcVoXSnPKA.review_text: My favorite watering hole in Hayes Valley. Sure there are bums chilling in the back room, stray dogs roaming around like they own the place, and a gnar bathroom that makes you really worry about catching something....but hell, this is just the way of the pig!   Bartenders are always friendly here. They have a myriad of couches. Good music. Laidback vibe. No pretentious shmucks here (so far...I think). Place Pigalle, you are swell.

sR0I3N5q58Ne5EysyvZkPw.review_text: The only reason why I would stick around in Hayes Valley after 11pm.

L-GQph-9IrXoKbvGJgz3uw.review_text: i like this place for the following reasons: great lil selection of red wines (la crema pinot = yummers) awesome variety of beers on tap dogs allowed! pool window seating fun, unpretentious vibe and i heard it was haunted. awesome!!! 4.5 stars for that.

K9_ag_YzqTMhWu51HMrcrg.review_text: Stopped by here recently to meet up with old friends back in town for the holidays.  We had a great night to ourselves fines selection of beers on tap. OK maybe i had 3 too many of The Dogfish Head 90min IPA but what the hell it's not every bar you can grab a few pints of this. I think they had 20 beers on tap total all craft beers. Something for everyones taste my buddies made there way through most of them with no complaints ;) Overall a great bar for those who enjoy the finer beers in life and a laid back atmosphere. Music was spot on and oh yeah a free pool table. Can't be bad at that

4yUd-vuVC6Tcp7wsS6uTyA.review_text: Place Pigalle is Pleasant  I've only been to this joint twice even though it's right up the street from my house.  Just got back tonight from a couple of happy hour beers with my buddy Michael.   Yeah, the joint isn't sophisticated or necessarily clean, but that's the charm of it. It's simple, fun, has pool and fooze ball and a great variety of beers on tap. . .I even saw people ordering wine, though that's one thing I wouldn't do at a neighborhood bar---they seemed to be fine with it.  The bartender was sweet and helpful. . . very apologetic when she accidentally sprayed me with Guinness (damn! I should have asked for a free pint, huh?). . . And! $6.50 for a couple of pints of Boddingtons--NOT BAD, eh?   Anyway, I'll definitely be back . . . at least I can crawl home afterward.

YbsBsaNKi2TwbVCZkuqrqg.review_text: This is like the least divey-est "dive bar" I have ever been to. The Place has a decent beer selection, pool, foosball, plus great tunes, and it's in Hayes Valley, which is super cute. It's not dirty or douchey. Came here to meet some friends and in turn met their coworkers and good times were had by all. I would definitely visit again.

4Po_4vgdBFk2GPeKfJqVww.review_text: Martin's new to the hood.  He needed some support in trying it all on for size.  Dinner at Bar Jules and a beer later, somewhere, anywhere.  And that's exactly what we found.  Anywhere.    Place Pigalle could be any bar on any street in any neighborhood.  But that's what makes it awesome.  Not flashy.  Just good beers, 1 single pool table, a chill "local" crowd, and a cool bartender.  Its your first stop before going out; your last stop after a rowdy night; your stop for a whisky after a rough day at work; your stop for a beer on a warm Saturday afternoon.    But, you lose 1 star for serving jello shots.  I know, I know...you all want to think its cool.  I just think its lame.  Let's all grow up, shall we?

dQrYvQv-2amtchPF2V0K8Q.review_text: A pretty average bar with one exception -- they have a great wine selection for a dive bar.  None of the wines are particularly nice (probably all stuff you find at Trader Joe's), but being able to choose from over a dozen wines is nice.  That said -- most people probably choose one of over a dozen beers while they're waiting to get plastered on Optimator at Suppenkuche next door.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: I'm going to have to say that I really enjoyed my time here. It's a cozy, comfortable bar with comfy couches and nice local patrons. How can you go wrong with that? It also had a pool table, which is always fun! It's pretty close to my place and it's in a cute little neighborhood. It's basically just a simple but fun and relaxing dive, which is good for conversation and meeting new people!

4Y81J2Tdq5XAnkeYmCZ2ow.review_text: You simply can't come to Place Pigalle expecting it to be like other bars. It's a dump. You really might as well stay home and drink on your own couch, rather than drink on Pigalle's filthy furniture and have to pay for stale beer (seriously, EVERY beer on tap was FLAT. Gross.) I understand how certain people would adore this place for it's comfortable simplicity, but if you want to feel like you're "going out" vs. chilling in your basement, you should look elsewhere. Pigalle is just not my thing, but maybe it's yours...?

zaz_5qYy3DSr-W8312PCiA.review_text: I love this place. Moderately price beer, nice bartender with an attitude. Foosball. Nice foosball table, at that. They also have the most awesome selection of music of any bar I have ever been to. It went from Weezer to Wu-tang. Awesome.

QtQrPd6YPJKNC7YG7G0LLQ.review_text: Good local bar.  Pool tables in the back, but they only serve beer and wine.  No cocktails.

-eVlHbM2KRZQnBqfTXtDvw.review_text: The guy out front carded me.  Me.  Way past my prime, suburb living, SUV driving, eyebag having, mother of a 3 year old whose boobs are in a race to see which one reaches my waist first.*  I was in awe and said, "Dude!  I'm 40!"  "You don't look it."  !!!  5-stars forever for Place Pigalle and bouncer dude.  *TM, Maya Angelou

6RJBeJlbDGrZO91Qc2NG9A.review_text: Since there is a dirth of small, privately owned AFFORDABLE and quaint places to go in Hayes Valley that doesn't cater to the theatre & symphony 6pm rush, this place is it.  With the exception of Sugar down the street, you won't find a more relaxed, casual, easygoing place for locals to grab a beer or wine (no hard liquor license).

NN5jldDW0Puf8E3ZZjKqsg.review_text: Place Pigalle was my happy hour destination of choice for several years, since I worked at nearby City Hall, and toyed with being a smoker for a while. It's a good place to be a smoker. And those places are necessary and I'm glad they exist; I'm not really on board with the anti-smoking crusade thing. I mean if we're fighting a war on corporate carcinogens, I would love to see a major ad budget allocated to dry cleaning, but that's a separate rant.   Anyway, Place Pigalle. It's a chill ass place to run through a bottle of cheap red and a pack of Export-A's with a couple of good friends.   Good times, good times.  I also feel compelled to add that Place Pigalle has been unfairly persecuted, and thus I feel compelled to add a possibly-excessive fifth star.   FOR GOD'S SAKE PEOPLE STOP BITCHING ABOUT SOJU. Do you even understand why so many places have it!? It's not, contrary to popular opinion, because the nightlife mafia is in cahoots with the Koreans, or because they want you to think it's the trendy new thing, or that it's some bullshit copout cheap subsitute for vodka. It's not, like, a CHOICE bars make when they're opening up, like "Should we serve just beer & wine, or liquor too? What shall we do?"  There are LICENSES required to sell alcohol. There are DIFFERENT TYPES of licenses within the broader license category; for example, a place that has a kitchen and serves food concurrent with booze has a different license type (a Type 47) than a bar with no food (a Type 48). Similarly, a microbrewery (Type 23), winery (Type 02), and corner liquor store (Type 21) all have different classifications based on what types of alcohol they sell, when, how, and to whom. This is all regulated at the STATE LEVEL.  It's an incredibly arduous, expensive, hard as fuck process to obtain the kind of license that allows a bar to serve hard alcohol without a restaurant component (48), and city neighborhoods often have tighter controls on such licenses. (For example, the Lower Haight has per-block restrictions on hard alcohol. Think about how many beer/wine bars there are on the Lower Haight. Now you know why.)   But because San Franciscans love our nightlife and there's a market to support multiple bars in every neighborhood, many bars do what they can to simply exist, and that often means a license permitting beer & wine only.  Place Pigalle has a Type 42 (Beer & Wine, On Sale, which means drinking ON the premises versus taking it off, like a liquor store.) And they do what they can within the confines of their license and the regulatory environment to offer you a variety of beverage options. And that's how you should think of soju: as a bonus third option beyond simply beer and wine. Because it's a clear spirit and mixes well but is technically (percentage-wise) a wine, Soju allows bars a workaround to provide you with a cocktail where there would have been none before. I appreciate that.  And just so you know, most of the RESTRICTIONS on hard alcohol licenses (Type 48 "On Sale General, Public Premises" no food required) grew out of NIMBYist fear and paranoia that booze = higher crime rate. And maybe it does. But if you think that's a bullshit generalization, as I do, and you would really like to sway our public policy in a more tolerant direction, get educated about the issues and get active!

VFbXrRqfuWnCnK4gSv51vA.review_text: something about this place rubs me the wrong way,  a cozy neighborhood bar that isn't cozy a hipster zone that isn't hip i don't get it,  to each their own i suppose.

q6mKVMvmhhbJU_YcfqXyMg.review_text: Smoky, hipsters, but there are some interesting 'characters' that give the joint 'flavor.'

K-NT_xHy7q779oSPLCyvNQ.review_text: Place Pigalle is the kind of bar I would be enamored of if it...  -- Was in the Mission or Inner Richmond instead of Hayes Valley..  -- Had sexy punk rockers with sweet arm tats hanging out at the bar instead of Hayes Valley yuppies...  -- Had a name that I wasn't embarrassed to say because I'm a Francophobe (I KNOW I come off sounding like a hater, 'kay?)...  -- Had cheap food like sloppy burritos or crappy late night Thai within a block instead of over-priced Middle Eastern where the falafel has SHREDDED LETTUCE AND TOMATOES in it (I'm not gonna knock Frijtz, though -- Frijtz is heaven with dipping sauce).  In short, if it was the 540 Club or the Attic.  You are not punk rock, Place Pigalle! You are a poser. But, you're the best thing in the neighborhood.

dym7k3h_wqBiJcXVu6WKuw.review_text: This place is underrated and under appreciated. I am fine with that. I heard that it legitimately wasn't so great a few years back. What it does well now is straddle the line between being divey and loungy. It has a pool and foosball table, but awesome, edgy art on the walls. It has nice leather couches, but the walls and floors look stressed. The crowd is a mixture of riffraff and hipsters, but also locals and trendy Hayes Valley wanderers. It's open really late. The beer and wine are really cheap and yet (gasp) they accept credit cards. This is the definition of a good neighborhood watering hole. If I need a drink on my way home or am just catching up with a friend this is where I go.

rwP2ALojVp2t6LrT7vlViQ.review_text: The prices were average, but the bartender was so rude that I decided not to give them any money. It was good for a group though, because it was fairly empty.  Also, the music was AWFUL.

oPW-LM0pXja0lDwZybXd9g.review_text: This place SHOULD perform better.  They serve Guinness, have a pool table, comfy chairs, and a good location.  But the beer tastes funny, the furniture is dirty as $#!+, the bathroom is - well, use your imagination, and the bartenders are as friendly as a skunk's ass.  Unless I'm perfectly desperate to get out and my friends have resolved to come here, I would rather drink at home.  Still, they serve Guinness and have a good location.

eSd1vgu3JIIJluhEK2Em3A.review_text: For a dive bar, I thought this place was pretty great. The beer is decently priced ($4.25 for Fat Tire, not bad), the bartender was really nice (and nice to look at *wink*), the music was perfect, and AND there were COUCHES in this bar. I will definitely be back.

OMwf9XKXdtd_77Fa2bcPzQ.review_text: Went here for the first time on a Wednesday night, and even then, it was decently packed. Not quite sure what to think yet. I will probably go again to write a better review later. But first impressions:  1.) Laid back / very chill vibe. 2.) Diverse crowd (hipsters, yuppies, older people in their 40's??) 3.) Large selection of beer and wine only (no hard stuff). But that's cool with me since I usually just drink beer. PBR is only $2.75 here.  4.) 1 pool table and 1 foosball table. 5.) Lotsa comfy couches 6.) Hip hop music (the latest Common CD and an old school Digable Planets CD was playing). A bit too loud though. 7.) Someone mentioned this earlier, but I must concur. Not a very attractive crowd. And my presence doesn't make it any better either.  Will write more later.

yl6XMllhyZGKA9qKNLYK4Q.review_text: I used to love Place Pigalle, but the smoke and irritating hipsters have finally got the best of me.

n7O0f4CHUtw5B3ldoKY_RA.review_text: I love to go to "the pig" on tuesdays and saturdays because the bartender is fabulous. they have soju jello shots on saturdays and sometimes they have a "play your ipod" evening (not sure when but I see the sign up whenever I'm there). it's dingy and lit in the back, which is strange and wonderful. sometimes they have popcorn.  they always have art on the walls from local artists. their beer selection is pretty rockin' and i had this really yummy sweet red porto last time I was there that I was really surprised about. dive bar porto that was actually relatively yummy (it wasn't any late harvest zinfindel from rutherford hill, but it did the job when I wanted sweet and warm!) some may not like it that dogs are allowed but I figure, some bar's gotta do it so if you don't like dogs, don't go - that easy. :)

GVwIu4a2OEJ4SvllFHoNCQ.review_text: Any place with a pool table and a fuseball table automatically scores high.  This place wins for it's low key feel and low comfy couches.  A good dive bar, but the smoke can sometimes be a drag.

GqAWZId7sUGylHljDFbe2A.review_text: for hanging out, pitchers of beer, pool and fuse ball. it's a good time

wbAnJpZ0Lmj3LeXg4pmq_w.review_text: $10 pitcher of PBR!  Bar tenders are always friendly and remember the regulars!  I live a half block down, so I end up here way too often and normally end up having a good time here! Foosball tables add to the FUN!

Nsr2JEsYP7kxKOaUz-2T5w.review_text: The manager of this place came out and started harassing my friend just for standing in front of the store front. He was angry because he believed her being there was keeping people from coming inside his bar however this happened at 2pm and the posted hours are 5pm- 2am so I don't understand why he was giving her attitude. RUDE!

w7CvXX2dtmPCm67TRJw7kQ.review_text: I have a soft spot in my heart for this little bar in Hayes Valley. As well, I have a standing date every Thursday with this bar, Anye the bartender, one of my gal pals, and a couple of glasses of pinot noir.   I'm not big into cocktails unless I'm watching live music, so a no-spirit bar like this one suits me fine. Particularly when Anye keeps the wine a-comin'.  The unisex bathroom has dilapidated greatly over the past few years, but the graffiti is, at times, entertaining. I really wish it could be done-over, but it's not bad enough to keep me from coming back.   The music is random but entertaining. I don't agree with those who say it's too loud, but I only go on Thursdays, so I can't speak for the other nights. I'm sure Mr. or Miss Bartender wouldn't mind turning it down if they're asked nicely, though. Just an idea.  It sports interesting and changing artwork. The couches are comfortable and reminiscent of basement rec rooms, but I never find myself in the back unless I'm waiting to brave the bathroom.   The clientele runs the gamut from yuppies to dirty hippies to symphony/ballet goers to hipsters to dogs. It's a comfy place and I always meet interesting (or at least entertaining) people there.

qAJqfV-sLU3nYatpOXjExA.review_text: Why is this place always so packed?  I always have wine spilled on me or get humped by a random dog when I'm here.  Of course, if I was a beer-o-phile, I'd probably have to give it another star because they apparently have a good beer selection.

BzsL4Un6x4_zNq3CXA71Tg.review_text: My local watering hole. Perfect for grabbing a drink and catching up with friends. Place Pigalle is a staple in my social diet. It is a reasonably large space, filled with lots of comfy couches and local art. Friendly locals, good music, and a pool table mean you're always apt to be entertained.

RVEo3hKrwSglj1vc6vu5SA.review_text: This is a solid place to grab a drink. I never really go into Hayes Valley and the last time I was here was St. patrick's Day '03. That afternoon went something like this: "Arrgggh. Woo-hoo. Weeee. Chug It! Yeah. Yeah! So much. Dude, I'm having so much fun right now! Weeee". Anyway, "Graphic D.L." and I stopped by last night to grab a drink and catch up. Perfect for an early Tuesday because it wasn't crowded in the slightest and we had a very friendly bartender and the music was pretty good. The drinks are expensive though. I mean, ouch! At any rate, I'm sure I'll be back now that I have a new appreciation for this place and that bartender who I didn't care for socially back in '03 is now gone. So long, sucka'.

PauNerg-kHRpoqLwB6F5CQ.review_text: My first thought was that this Place was way too nice to be classified as a dive bar, and the prices agree with me. (~$5/beer, which isn't bad overall) There are several leather loveseats if you want to cuddle up with a date, or sit at the copper-topped bar and peruse the extensive beer list chalked on the overhead board. The back section, with the pool table, can apparently be reserved for parties. All in all, a decent choice in this neighborhood.

DGlEpdOgkK8B4bJ3QUtd1A.review_text: A great beer selection, a $2.75 draft happy hour and a policy of accepting credit cards for even small bar tabs... I used to love this place until tonight, when I had to deal with at least four people smoking cigarettes (and there were probably more in the back based on the amount of smoke in the bar).  I used to be a strong advocate of smokers' rights at the turn of the millenium, but since then I have grown to appreciate not having to scrub the smoke off of me after a night of drinking. It's not even like the bartender was a smoker, he just had a "well, I'm not a smoker but I guess I am tonight" attitude.  A dozen beers on tap, soju cocktails, and credit cards accepted. The bar can keep one point for my history with them. That's it. With much better places to drink without the airborne carcinogens, this rainy Friday night will be my last time there.

JDn2ZLcWDx8BNv70Of-g3A.review_text: Back in the day I used to be extremely depressed and lonely so after work I would go home, drop my shit off, and walk around the corner to the bar.  I'd order a Lagunitas, get out my crossword puzzle, sit on an old couch, and smoke several cigarettes through the course of the evening.  Then I'd watch the ugly neighborhood girls flirt with the uglier douchebag neighborhood guys.  One time, I was sitting at the bar, and this seemingly normal woman who owns some gift card shop in the Marina sat next to me and was chatting  me up.  Then I felt like she was going to hit on me or something and it made me want to throw up.  So no. I don't go there any more.  But it's really great if you're depressed and don't mind smoking a lot and sitting on a really gross couch.

a8wKua129w25q4wtP26p2g.review_text: Decent beer selection. That's about it. Not very inviting/welcoming. Not impressed.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: Full bodied spicy wine... CHECK  Full bodied spicy wine by the bottle for a reasonable price... CHECK  Full bodied entertainment in the form of Marina guys with popped collars wearing Nylon tennis shorts and tennies on a Saturday night in Hayes Valley... CHECK  Full bodied run in with a blind date turned positive encounter vs. awkward hello... CHECK  Full bodied good time and new favorite within stumbling distance of the humble abode bar... CHECK.  Oh yes, I'll be back!

a682iLOKBLSwOojw9O9XYg.review_text: Just ok. Great beer selection BUT the service so-so. We were unlucky to have a horrible bartender who was more concern with having a conversation with a fellow customer than helping and waiting on the rest of us. You would think that sitting at the bar would bring faster service .....however not the case. My girlfriend litterly had to go and grab him from across the way in order to get another beer/ wine refill.

h3Yg3OE9uD6XEAPyEm3qEQ.review_text: Place Pigalle could easily be found in Austin (that is the highest compliment I can give a dive bar).  Good variety of draft beers, though there were more hefeweizens than I would expect. Prices were incredibly reasonable.  Good variety of patrons. Anyone could fit in here.   Good place to meet up before heading somewhere else.  Pool and foos ball in the back.

IWal1ziP1AlfcgDJj5CKFw.review_text: Had a group of friends meet there on Friday night - full of folks but mellow. not jam packed.  only drawback can be too many dogs, some of which fight with each other.  foosball is a big bonus points getter in the back.  sofas comfy.  saturday bartender daniel was there on friday as a customer and he was sloshy!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text:
So I've made out with a few too many randoms after too many soju cocktails at this HV gem, but that's not the bar's fault.  I love Place Pigalle because the bartender is hot, the cocktails actually get me buzzed, and I can smoke (my #1 priority after two drinks)! 
 Also, the crowd is NOT snobby, frat-boyish, or yucky, a rare find in our fair city. Be warned: NO real booze; just beer, wine, and soju. So get your ass to Pigalle, order a flirtini or a soju lemmon drop, flirt with the bartender or the cute Hayes Valley hipster boys, and stumble home, feeling all boozey and beautiful.  
 WARNING: it can get a little smokey. If you're allergic or just generally health conscious, you may want to pass.

XMeRHjiLhA9cv3BsSOazCA.review_text: What happened to Place Pigalle?  I'd have given it 5 stars a month ago, but recently this Place (ha ha) has been plagued by a bunch of middle-aged Johnsons.  What happened to all the hipsters? Why all the faded ill-fitting Gap chinos now?  Oh right, the recent smoking ban... Pros and cons, pros and cons...  And why oh why is there just one bathroom?

A7FNqfL30IjpcQ6fQffoOQ.review_text: This is a case of one of those spots that is cool but goes wrong somewhere along the way. First off people can smoke in there, the beer selection though decent is poorly maintained. The tap lines are not clean resulting in that oxidized taste ( kinda like wet cardboard). For me that is more than enough to stay away. If you are fine with their assortment of soju cocktails head on down but their are places that have well kept beer which look just as cool.

JySeqsQuAgrNRJpyRsxqOA.review_text: Amazing. I love this bar and am so happy it's on my street. It's your typical dive bar with dim lighting, good music and mismatched, craigslisted couches....but it works.  Only complaint - atrocious bathroom. 5 stars if they fixed/cleaned it up a bit.

Rylpa0IwBOBOL-idN-QpwQ.review_text: look, i'm a lush, ok?  i know it.  my friends know it.  my mom knows it.  ok, my boss doesn't know it, at least not yet, but i've only been at my gig three weeks so the truth will come out sooner or later.  my point is this.  i spend a lot of time in bars.  i spend a lot of time at pigalle.  i don't miss being able to smoke inside, the bathroom is as nasty as everyone says and lindsey, i love you, but please turn the music down, i should not have to shout at my friends at 7pm on a tuesday night.  yes, i will have another house red, thanks.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: I'm giving this place three stars mostly because its my neighborhood bar, they have an excellent beer selection and I've had good times here but its changed for the worst.  It used to be a great low-key hipster bar.  It used to take cash only and smoking was allowed inside which wasn't great but it added to the atmosphere.  Lastly you could have a good conversation despite the fact that there might be a decent amount of groups hanging around the place and you might even start chatting with a few people you didn't know because you saw them here 3 or 4 nights a week.    Fast forward to Place Pigalle no longer allowing smoking.  Now its become overrun with marina types and others who mainly communicate to each other by yelling "WOOOOOOOOO!".  You can't even play foosball anymore without running into a gang of douchebags who mastered it while living at the frat house.  It seems people choose to travel there in groups of 8 or more so usually all the seats are taken or being used to hold people's jackets.  Now you can't even have a conversation because the bartenders crank up the music to drown out all the idiots.  It used to be my great kickback neighborhood bar but now the place just reeks of designer jeans, expensive dresses and post-birthday dinner balloons.  But lets look at the bright side, their soju and wine sales have gone through the roof.  Oh yeah, did I mention there is a lone bathroom and this place sells primarily beer?  At least get a coffee can out back to alleviate some of the line...

IUBTHEaCm-1xcv1lT99eWw.review_text: Real chill spot in Hayes Valley.Its very comfortable with many couches and tables and also has a pool table, foosball, and darts. Its got a very social atmosphere, great place to come with a group or by yourself. You can pretty much guarantee to see some really shitfaced people if its after 12 but they're the friendly drunk type, not the aggressive kind.   Also, they're pretty chill about dogs as long as they're friendly. My dog Edgar plays great with the resident drunk dog Sancho so its fun to bring him down there.  One of the best things about this place is the music. They don't have a jukebox but the bartenders have great taste, especially Lindsay (my former roommate who updates her ipod off my computer so obviously her music selection is great). They lose one star because they don't serve hard booze and you can smoke in there so it can get kinda nasty.

WtARDTeVa3r8mLx6d4iLxA.review_text: I love this neighborhood bar so much that even though it's not in MY neighborhood, I'll take a cab to hang out here. It's a wine/beer/sake bar that has super nice bartenders, comfy couches and a pool table. The music is always great, although it can be a little bit loud for intimate conversations. There are awesome restaurants nearby (Frites, Suppenkuche, Absinthe to name just a few) and Place Pigalle is a great stop after one of them, before heading home.

7LxY5qFm8xYAq91LoSmq-Q.review_text: I was just thinking about how I hate this place because generally that's how I believe I feel about it...but I was just now really giving it a good few minutes of brain power when I realized this place isn't all that bad.   The things is, this place only serves beer and wine, and, in my opinion, beer and wine bars are really just a huge joke. Its like going to a steakhouse that only serves grilled chicken. Plus, I looooooooove vodka.  You can't smoke inside anymore, which is fine. I'm a pretty chill smoker when it comes to non-smoking. Happy hour, from what I recall, is really weak and there's a slight possibility that one of the bar backs stole Joshua's phone off the ground under his feet.  The thing is, every time I've been I've enjoyed myself. So maybe I should stop hating this bar and start drinking there after work. And maybe you should too.  Oh. BTW, the bathroom is HELLA gross. Save it for later, dudes.

-r7eyvyw0wnGOv6kV7Q6nA.review_text: when you step into place pigalle it really does feel like you're stepping into some artsy, bohemian neighborhood joint.. hipsters gather around pool tables, foosball and darts waxing poetic about varies sundry topics surrounding our metaphysical existence or whatsoever...  smokers brazenly light up their cigarettes right in front of a large "no smoking" sign in the middle of the bar, adding to the hazy ambiance of the place...  bar staff is friendly and attentive, and this beer and wine bar has a nice full list of beers for my liking.  the next morning, you wonder how it is that you were able to stumble home, and are reminded of pre-smoking-ban days since your clothes kinda stink like an ashtray.  i like place pigalle, i like that it has a neighborhoody feel even on the weekends.. so that's ok if i have to do laundry now.

CDtbuyJBYyDT21lJMod6OA.review_text: This place was awesome!  And the funnest part of my Hayes Valley bar hopping night... I came here in that buzzed haze, it was kinda crowded but we snagged a couch in the back.  I love how spacious this place is... it reminds me of like... a living room/rec room in a dorm... if that helps your imagination?  PLUS THEY HAVE MBC RASPBERRY BEER!  I have never seen this at any bar EVER besides MBC and I was so happy...   If I can drag all my friends down that far again, I definitely would love to hang here.  Too bad I don't live in Hayes Valley.  :(

quQ5DemjP-buwKXrhAlefQ.review_text: This place is divey and sometimes smells a little funky, but I still like because its a block from my house.  Pool tables are a PLUS Loungey couches are a PLUS Big Pours on the wine glasses are a BIG PLUS  One time I came here and they were out of wine (gasp!). I had to go to Sugar Lounge (double gasp!!). Another time or two they were out on all wines except one kind. Its a freakin beer and wine bar so get it together people. Gross gross bathrooms are a big neg, but they come with the territory.   I really like to come here and chill with friends to just catch up, its always a mixed crowd too so you never really know what to expect.

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: So the hipsters can tell me this is dark and moody place to chat when they're over the crowd at the Rickshaw, but if you have had a hole in your lungs and aren't a fan of smoking, this place may almost kill you.

RAPbrD1BndCQNgkncd1-kA.review_text: This place is just right.  It's got a cool and calm crowd, with people who know how to play pool, fooseball, and smoking.

hj7U5xIeohSoryeV2yVvRA.review_text: I don't know, it's very close to me which makes it convenient but it just is kinda off in my experience.   They have a great selection of beers, but are usually out of at least half of them.   They have some comfy looking couches, but they are right by the speaker that is playing way too loud music.  I'd say that i'm just too old, except that there are much older people there.  Service is hit or miss. I will go here but I'd much rather be somewhere else.

icK0fkhTkPWvRmOhFUINfA.review_text: this had the potential for being my neighborhood bar, as it apparently is for many.  a good place to catch up with friends, drink, relax, play pool and hang out. unfortunately, my body has become spoiled and accustomed to california no smoking laws that i can't spend more than 15 minutes in the place before feeling like an ashtray was dumped on top of me.

thY4tADfgZPJwySQmRkG9g.review_text: I don't really think this qualifies as a dive bar. It's too pretty. You might call it a dive bar, because it's quirky, but that connection is a bit far fetched. It has a comfortable, laid back feel. But it lacks the uber cheap prices of the common dive bar - forgive them, they are located in Hayes Valley after all.   What I like most are the variety of seating options. There are couches, from the front to back of the bar, which is rather large. There is a pull table in the middle of the back room. My friend and I sat in a booth in the back which felt very private.   The drink options aren't amaaazing. The wine I had was good, but rather pricey. They serve La Crema wine, which I think tastes just like grape juice. So all and all, you can easily purchase some of the wine they serve in a corner store in the mission paying the same price for the bottle as you do for a glass at Place Pigalle. This is in no way unique to PP. This is done virtually everywhere in the city. I just happened to know the wines at PP. Thus, I am not taking a star off for that. What you're paying for, in my opinion, is the atmosphere, and I like the atmosphere at PP a lot.   The other patrons are young for the area, which made me feel more at ease. Different age groups mix together though, so it's not like a young mission bar.   I look forward to coming back here.

b0lXNnfnZpKPv7xNwpG3Ig.review_text: Decided to give this place another go after stopping by earlier in the year to find it closed.  I think I might have given it 4 stars if the back area didn't have a weird smell.  And it was really empty when we got there yesterday which made the big open back space seem kind of depressing.   The pluses are that there are lots of tasty beers on tap and $1 off during happy hours which goes until 7 I think.  The booths in the front are comfy and great for lounging around and catching up with friends.  When we first go there didn't see a bartender behind the bar and finally after a few minutes he pops over.  There aren't a ton of bar options on Hayes so I'm glad that this place opened up again.  Casual place to grab a drink if you are waiting to eat at Suppenkuche or have dinner plans nearby.

ppkBNgjuAwNsoiddIt3mzw.review_text: I'm not a violent person  I don't like to see blood, I don't (usually) like to see people get hurt but... a bar fight at 7:30pm on a Monday night?! that's comedy! (considering the douchebag that got socked deserved it)  The place has everything a local pub should have, (a little too loud) music, bar-seating, several tables, a big booth seat for a large party and some couches you can even let your dog nap on.  Speaking of dogs...  My dog has devoured many beer coasters here and the barkeep just chuckles.  I like it for what it is...just a regular pit stop for us lazy folks who don't have the energy to leave the block.

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: Beer and wine is what they serve in this Hayes Valley bar. Place Pigalle is alright because it's chill and they have a pool table. Come for the chill, stay for the vibe. I gotta whole lotta waves of friendliness when I came here. The front was light and the back was dark. I don't know if I was blind.

WFRWsmj5YWH_p665GvaNIg.review_text: I used to live around the corner from this place and it was a regular post-work/pre-party stop for beers with my favorite humans.  Although it's full of out-of-neighborhooders on the weekends, I think it's a much better backdrop for casual shit. They don't have a full liquor license but this isn't where you'd go to get fucked up in the first place.

YznzHIJw2FH8RfkAF9-svg.review_text: Great spot. I'm new to San Fran and this was a great suggestion from friends. A cozy bar area in the front, pool table in the middle, and nice open airy plush couch seating in the back. It was a perfect place to meet up after the baseball game, they have tvs for those who don't make it to the ballpark and plenty of restos nearby if you wanna bring in a late night bite. Pssst... Don't get food from the Mediterranean places closest by, Hayes & Kebab, it's no bueno! With only one pool table be prepared for the take turns :) however, with ample space in the back of the establishment, you will have no problem grabbing a seat, standing around a seating area, or making your way to the bar and back. There are also a great deal of boutiques nearby, so be sure to check out this area in the day time!

5jLkKtE4HPlrbjw-0w9lvg.review_text: Very good beer selection in the heart of Hayes Valley. Whether you're taking a break from shopping, or on your way home from work, Place Pigalle is a cool place to hang out and grab a pint.  Bonus: it's across from Paxti's!

iYeOigbzvpgtCfr_wbOawQ.review_text: Tonight I discovered that I like Hayes Valley. Oh, let the fusspots begin their comments on snobbery and affluenza, it's cozy. AND this bar was a great find. The red wine prices - lowest glass is $6.50, highest is $10.50.  They got pool tables, they got foozball. They got a great seating options. It doesn't smell like old beer on the floor and the bartender shared his pizza break with a homeless guy. That's downright sweet.  Nice atmosphere in a nice little spot. I found it on a Sunday night so the parking wasn't a nightmare and you know, I might just have to recommend this as a regular Sunday night haunt.

1z5LVnZhXrWgsQgMDpIIzw.review_text: how could you not like a place that's named after the red light district in Paris's Montmartre neighborhood (remember Moulin Rouge?  the Muse de l'rotisme?), as well as where some of the most famous artists lived and worked (Van Gogh, Dali, Toulouse-Lautrec, Picasso and Pigalle himself)?  my first trip to Paris, when i was 15, we stayed in an apartment in this area, right above le sex shoppe....quite an experience, i must say...coming to this bar takes me back there...  i love that this slightly dive-y, crusty bar is in such a hipster neighborhood.  it has such character.  and my doggy is welcome there.  and i like electronica, so the music doesn't bother me one bit, nor does the fact that there are more men in there than women (good odds for me : ).  and it's walking distance from my house, and the bartenders are cool.  i had such a blast there last night, talking to a sister of perpetual indulgence and his dog...  sitting on one of their couches, beer in hand, yogi the dog sitting in my lap snoozing, i feel at home...

GfB6sC4NJQvSI2ewbQrDNA.review_text: I really want to like this place but every time I go I just can't feel the vibe.  I don't like smoke so the smoking kills me.  I also like my beer in cold glasses, especially if the beer isn't that cold.  It seems to me that every time I go here the glasses are luke-warm which to me makes the beer taste funny.  The last time they cleaned their couches seems like 1990. I give it 3 stars because it's one of the only decent bars in Hayes Valley.  The bartenders aren't too friendly either.

BUdazFZ3cs-CVKqnLgJKPw.review_text: what's not to love? it's a dive, it's a block from my pad, and (some) people there know my name. in addition, its many couches (shabby chic?!) and welcoming bartenders hosted me upon my arrival in the nabe, quickly making me feel right at home.

Yx93cixWqq_DZZqIX2WXuQ.review_text: Ok, let me start out by saying I can't believe I have to give this place a 2 star review.  They have great beer, nice atmosphere and they let some people bring their dogs ins which was awesome.  The music selection on the Juke Box is the good kind of eclectic.  Only one toilet though for the whole place though...  On to why I had a bad experience.  So this bar tender who kinda looks like Robert Downey Jr was terrible.  1.) It took him like 3 - 5 min to finally come to the bar so I could get my first drink even though there were like 10 people in the whole establishment, none of whom were ordering drinks.  (apparently this is normal since I heard the same complaint from other patrons) 2.) I asked if they took credit card and he just kinda looked at me and nodded in a pompous manner.  3.) He gave me a glass which was chipped and when I showed it to him he feels the chip and instead of throwing away the glass he just puts it back in the dish washer.  The guy was just an overall d-bag and really put a damper on my experience.

XnBflxEeUp0C-MefpSSTMg.review_text: Home of the 12 oz pint.....   I have been a patron of Place Pigalle for more than a decade. It/s nice now, stil trying to find it's stride. One thing that REALLY disapoints are the 12 oz pints ( we checked / verified with a 12oz empty beer bottle).   If you're going to charge a preimum price for beer why not give us a full pint like they do elsewhere in SF.   It's offensive when bars think they're patrons are not smart enough to figure this out - it's sad that we have to.  A pint is a pint but not at place pigalle

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: Came here with my couchsurfing group last night and I  loved this place...a plethora of comfy couches, pool, and foosball! They played Gipsy Kings on the radio so that made it all the better for me. Large back area that is wonderful for groups, and I love their Wyder's pear cider! I think it's so much sweeter and easier to drink than Magners/Bulmers, however I did not like having to pay like $4.50 (or so) for it.  They do not have a full bar, so don't expect to get your mixed drink fix here. It's mostly beer and wine.   The only thing that left something to be desired was the bathroom. They have only one (huge bummer as there were long lines yesterday) and it is unisex, and 99% of the time that means it's not well attended and not clean. This one wasn't filthy, but it could definitely have been better.  But overall, I loved Place Pigalle and I will definitely be coming back if nothing but for the pear cider!

hP8by2q4mgfQEvvhfChcbQ.review_text: I like it, I love it, I want some more of it. Great couch seating, friendly bartenders, pool tables, and foosball leads to way too much fun. I love that they do not serve all the hard stuff, leading me too often into shots of soju. It always seems like such a good idea at the time.

KKdBQXnUlVUZ0ZNTfMQoEA.review_text: I kinda hate this place. Sort of. It's great that it's a local bar and that they have a pretty decent beer selection. But everything else about it...pretty much sucks.  The space is dimly lit, but cold. The walls are barren and reflect sound way too much. The music of often too loud and displays any lack of creativity whatsoever. The bar is too high for the stools! Even though its the only "neighborhood bar" in Hayes Valley (a neighborhood I love), it doesn't really feel like one. You can't have a decent conversation in there either.  The incessant smoking of people either inside, or right outside the door adds to the problem. Also, there is a decided, if unintentional feeling that nobody attractive goes to this bar. I don't know how that's been decided, it just seems to be the case. I feel like Jeremy Clarkson in Top Gear when he describes an Audi or other german car. It has all the elements of a pretty nice place, but it just feels soul-less and dull.  Place Pigalle is only good if you are meeting up with 2-3 good friends and want to have a beer in an unpretentious setting. But...this definitely doesn't fill Hayes Valley's desperate need for a solid and reliable neighborhood hangout.

ZJyPAb6K6GNjG83fs5nDkw.review_text: Cool, cozy place.  The drinks are not that expensive and the crowd's always fun.  Been here with my friends 3 or 4 times already.  No bad experience here.  Just that the whole look of the place could be a lot better.  (And I love the pool table!)

-pvKGlb04e8brYqsXGteQw.review_text: If I were to describe Place Pigalle as a dive bar, it would only be said with fondness. This bar boasts a surprisingly diverse set of regulars, is comfortable yet quirky, and has a good selection of foreign beers.   Talking is easy here, and you can easily find yourself meeting new people. It's also one of the few places in SF where you can smoke in the bar (or at least one of the few places that doesn't throw you out for it). Lastly, it is the most unlikely place in the world to find Sake being served up, but there it is.   There are better places to go out in Hayes Valley, but Place Pigalle manages to remain a place you'd come back to.

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: This place is definitely the diviest (is that even a word?) bar that I have been to in a while. Great drink menu in theory. Although they didn't seem to have any of the white wines or champagne that they listed. They do have Blue Moon beer and that is a HUGE plus in my book.   Pool table in the back. Lots of couches. They tended to look a little run down but again, this is a dive bar. Cute little bartender. They need to give her a step stool though. It was really difficult for her to pass the pints over the beer taps. Management, do you think you could help a girl out?  Anyway, have to give them a star off for the tool that wouldn't leave me alone from the time I walked in. Group of about 5 or 6 dressed in what looked like Asian Army uniforms completely wasted at 5pm on a Sunday afternoon. Apparently their most suave seemed to think that I was dying to make conversation with him. The guy clearly had an alcohol induced speech impediment. It was funny in the beginning but started to make me anxious when he kept touching me. No one seemed terribly concerned but I also wasn't making a scene about it. I would not recommend this place for females going by themselves. Go with a girlfriend, go with a boyfriend but don't go alone. Don't get me wrong it's a cool place to hang out but when you don't feel completely safe on a Sunday afternoon...well ladies you know what I mean.

fzwx-6P-uGbowzFWycjPbw.review_text: Cheap, dark, decent music depending on the night, chilled out crowd, good couches, and a list of fine beers available by the pitcher.  What else could you ask for if you're looking for an on-the-way-home-from-dinner beer or 5?

PWohtvH6nTdvGCGeRzoUuQ.review_text: Some of my friends love Place Pigalle for its foosball, but I'm not really a fan.  I don't like the ambiance and in the few times I've gone have thought mean thoughts about the other patrons.  The bathroom is nasty, and there's only one, which is bullshit.  The good thing is they have a pretty good beer selection and the service is fine.

yiDwlpEVrxw-pc2DTInPsw.review_text: This dimly lit gem on Hayes serves a decent selection of Beer and Soju cocktails.  The staff is friendly and you can catch a dog or two roaming the bar on most nights...They have pool table and foosball, but the wait can sometimes suck.  Comfy couches and quiet-ish music make it great to meet some friends and share a few pitchers.  Smoking was recently banned in the bar (for what it's worth)

BRh5hZvTU-xYXux5WnjBMQ.review_text: Great little dive bar in Hayes Valley.  The remodeling definitely change it, but not too much to kill it's great reputation already.  Only beer and wine, so I'd give another star if it had liquor.  However, if you like beer and great selection of music, check it out.  You could do way worse in this area.

cz76cbJvk-ZLVTofNff0XA.review_text: Cool bar in Hayes. Not somewhere I'd go out of the way to go to, but the beers were good and cheap ($4-$6), there was a juke box, a pool table and seats. The music was a bit loud for it to be the  kind of bar you'd have a conversation in, but if you're looking to drink, chill and keep the talking to a minimum, then this may be the bar for you.

rshFnj9YqfmO5Yp2jsPjrA.review_text: BYOW- Bring Your Own Women.  This place was a complete dick farm when I went there last. I'm not much for beer and wine bars, either... I like the option to go liquor. The hip-hop was REAL loud, too.

Z9lfqMy5ZgZDig1uQCVt9Q.review_text: Not so bad. I've had some good and some boring nights here. Having a pool table is a plus. I can always find my friend throwing one back and chatting it up with his favorite bartender. He wants her badly. Applause him on his tenacity.  Other then that I am always impressed and I actually like the art on the wall. They even change it every month. Look on the table next to the couch that looks like its been used and abused for a decade and you'll find a nicely typed price list. And very affordable for artwork these days.

xW1VyqqsoASlUCMa7qjpXA.review_text: I'm moving to the neighborhood shortly and am in need of a new home-away-from-home. And it looks like Place Pigalle will do rather nicely!  Great relaxed atmosphere, good selection of beers (Chimay? Yes, please!), dog-friendly (I have none, but just try and tear me away from yours...), and an exceedingly courteous staff.   The first time I visited was a Sunday afternoon with the parents. The girl behind the bar was so welcoming and put up with dad's silly jokes and sarcasm. I think she even bought him a drink. Maybe she thinks he's as charming as I do!  Another giant plus: the ever-crowded Patxi's delivers from across the street.    Oh - and great tunes!  I plan to while away many happy hours on their bar stools over the next few years. If they'll have me.

hKozw4Wo1DAXtBomsqRCxQ.review_text: Met the ex there in line to the unisex bathroom - which, despite everything, is still a good memory, so I definitely have a soft spot for this place.  Comfy, dilapidated sofas, puppies allowed inside, a good beer selection, pool AND foosball, relaxed, cool people. Prices could be a bit cheaper for what you're getting, but hey, being in Hayes Valley, I'm sure their rent ain't cheap.  4 hipster stars for being an oasis of laid-back, divey relaxation amongst the yuppie madness that is the valley.

OFi92Xc2QyIr787GNKtgZA.review_text: My FAVORITE neighborhood dive bar. Given its Hayes & there's no other dive joints nearby so by default, its my favorite! But seriously, I enjoy it here. It's far from being divey at all, given that its more of an artsy lounge in the back. Nothing sleazy & trashy going on besides maybe the bathroom.  With the laid back vibe in general, you can always find a very mixed crowd on any night. There's plenty of seating along with several comfy couches and a pool table in the back, making Pigalle a relaxed bar fitting for its neighborhood.  The best part of Pigalle is actually the wide selection of craft beers offered on tap at prices equal to Lower Haight bars. There's plenty of IPAs and other ales all the time so it saves me a trip uphill to Haight, and if you prefer wine they also carry that. Chill bartenders.

Cx2E56zbHsxa6NE1Gdn_dQ.review_text: Smells beer and always filled with people. It has a nice and friendly vibe and is perfect for a beer a weekday night with friends. Unpretentious. They don't serve food but they have a menu for some pizza place with delivery if you're starving.

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: I find that my habit is to go from Biergarten to Place Pigalle as the sun starts to go down.   This bar is pretty chill. There's some nice window seating for you to gawk and shit talk about the passersby. The back room also has a pool table and more chill couches to lounge on.   Another plus is that it's a dog-friendly establishment, so I've seen a few canines hogging a seat every now and then. That's a good thing.

rCAIpsUDyknZBIctrSe9Cg.review_text: Not at all what I expected in this neighborhood. Billiards for a buck, weird drunk people (it *was* Friday night) and generally friendly folks. The bartenders were super fast and very nice. Bar up front and couches/pool table in the back. I found it very easy to strike up conversations here and the layout of the place is favorable for small to large groups. Yes, yes, yes it's a gentrified neighborhood so if you're looking for faux attitude you can go to Lucky 13 or Zeitgeist. Screw that, though, it's so totally last year; nice is the new black.! (that being said, nothing beats Zeitgeist on a warm summer evening). This place just is what it is. Not really lower haight, not really Marina. But I like it and I think I'd definitely go back. Oh yeah, and dogs. Not sure how I feel about that.

vODeKrgSvJt7Kr_cJTxohg.review_text: This is my favorite bar in my hood.  Allegash White? Check. Awesome friendly bartenders and lady's drink specials? Check. Pool table? Check. Dude, once the African American bartender (I don't know his name but he's my favorite fav) ordered a Paxti's pizza for the bar.  Sometimes the music gets waytoofuckingloud for conversation but eh. I love it.

LEXK_zrIgJyDw6xY8a1eGA.review_text: Now this is a dive bar I can dig. There's a pretty good wine and beer selection, and there are lots of couches and chairs that make for perfect "let's stick around for a while, bitch about life, and have another Stella" seating arrangements. There are few things that make me more uncomfortable than cigarette smoke and small yappy dogs, and I have to admit that both were on display tonight at Place Pigalle, but I think three stars fits the bill.

bk3LC4qjyk3VEVtpP4P68w.review_text: I love this place so much...so much in fact that I am using this for my 200th review.  Enough said.  Ha! gotcha! ...This place is my absolute hands down, one in a million, favorite dive bar.  (maybe not even a dive bar) Its in hayes valley, you can bring in pizza from across the street,  it serves mostly beer (with a few wine and sangria choices) and has a ton of awesome choices, has a decent juke box, a pool table, a ton of space...and wait for it......its DOG friendly!   Now, yes, its true, it took me like five times to actually learn the name of the place.  And its almost impossible to be a regular here because there are so many bartenders even the bartenders don't know each other...but its so chill and in walking distance form my place.   I have gone here dressed up from the opera and the following week dressed from a giants ball game.  Either way, it worked.  I've gone here after work on a Tuesday (lets not judge), and stayed until last call on a Saturday.    You often see the same people every time you go, so even though its in Hayes valley it seems very much a neighborhood bar...and on my birthday we were able to grab a few tables in the back, convince a few poor unassuming souls enjoying a beer to join, and we played cranium until the wee hours.   This really is my favorite place.

L2uIVVgoODNLj16V2U1eCg.review_text: Place Pigalle is really the only bar in Hayes Valley, which is a shame because it's either not trying very hard or it's seen seriously better days.   They have an excellent draught beer selection, but that's about it. The pool table is typically broken and/or missing one of the balls. The bathroom is terrifying--sometimes flooded--albeit with excellent graffiti. The bartenders are nice and, depending on which one is working, have good taste in music--which is key because they're in control of the iPod in the back room.  If you're in Hayes, it's a nice place to get a beer, but not really destination-worthy.

M4ZvZMlOCWO86i7vY_aPlQ.review_text: Dudes, one word:  foosball.  Oh, and they have Chimay and sake!  And darts.  And pool.  The pool table is always bogarted though because of that lame chalk board they have with names on it that somehow magically appear in front of yours when you're not looking.  A little loud for me and the lighting is strange.  Kind of like entering a cave at the front and coming out the other happy side with a drink in your hand...but hey what could be better than leaving a cave WITH a drink?  Sweet.  Good bar for the area since everything else is shi-shi minus Marlena's.

bA6sFAZTIc5ddwpnB_WJUw.review_text: Decent, large, unpretentious two room bar with friendly no-attitude bartenders, haphazard tables and benches, a pool table, large ecclectic draft beer selection, and a foosball table.  A favorite of neighborhood locals in the 25-35 age range.  Dark and red.  Quiet until 10 or 11 weeknights then it gets packed.  Prices are about average, wine list is expensive but reasonable given the selections.  It used to be known as a place to smoke.  They got busted and now it's smoke free.  The vibe is still smoky but not a dive.

ra3OzaxpILytSjHRRKoT8g.review_text: Low-key Hayes Valley joint that's relaxing and cool.  Sometimes I get tired of places that are all that, and this is all normal.

KdC7iPZxcArSX9VERfbGPA.review_text: Grunge decor tries hard. Pac Heights types look out of place. Count the striped shirts!

cmAHVj0b5Wz5Tun6Op0ksw.review_text: I would highly recommend this place for a low key dive bar in hayes valley.  This is a great place to wait for a table at suppenkuche and they even have happy hour prices. I was there from about 630-8 on a Friday night and there were couches and table available and even a pool table that was unfortunately occupied.

tx407EtvKoXXEZqYQFQVJA.review_text: "No really Jeff, Place Pigalle is a really good dive!"  Dude, I get free drinks at Zeitgeist.  The bartender at Lucky 13 pours me a Prohibition when he sees me walk in the door.  I refuse to go to the Haight without stopping by the Trophy Room.  I grew up half a block from Trad'r Sam.  I know "good dives," and those are "good dives."  So do NOT try to tell me that *Ha-YES Valley* of all places has a good dive bar.  This is one of the most gentrified strips in the City.  There's a Palo Alto restaurant across the street.  Hayes & Octavia?  "Dive" anything?  Please.  Holy crapcakes was I wrong.  Place Pigalle, frou-frou name and all, is a fucking awesome dive.  With a fantastic beer selection.  And a pool table.  And foosball.  And window seating.  And like, eleventy-three couches strewn about.  I knew I was completely wrong about PP when a dog wandered in, and the bartender invited him up onto a barstool.  You can't fake that, kids.  I have to take a star off for the listed prices.  Four bucks & change for a Prohibition is high.  $6.25 for a Hoegaarten is silly.  And $4.25 for a bottle of Corona is highway robbery (however, with a beer selection like PP's, you deserve what you get for ordering Corona).  These are not dive prices.  However, when you buy three drinks, and one is on the house, this pretty much ceases to be a problem.  Four-and-a-half stars.  Also of note, last night- a Sunday- everyone went outside to smoke, including the bartender.  So NYAH, you smelly bastards.

RQl9gX49kyXskpMvydzSwA.review_text: One of the best dive bars in SF, and really the only legit spot to hang out at in Hayes Valley.

djwgcGrEb7kFxvVcjNjivg.review_text: Four stars for everything a dive bar should have...good beer selection, solid staff and non-annoying customers.  Bonus star because I was lucky enough to be there when David Byrne showed up after his show with the Extra Action Marching Band who took over the place and rocked out.  I'll be a fan for life after that night.

NeHxrGuSN_Ktq498F6k2MA.review_text: Went here after a bday dinner at Suppenkuche, and had a great time. They have a couple couches at the front end, which we gathered around. It was comfy, cheap and had good bar service.  It wasn't crazy crowded, which is what we enjoyed about it. We could all sit comfortably and talk (without yelling) and drink together. They had some good dance music playing even though there wasn't a dance floor (at least not that I saw, but I didn't wander past the bar), which just kinda made the place perfect for that relaxing, but fun atmosphere our group was after.  I would def go again.

pPC2m5MZMf0u1BlHjT4CMw.review_text: Overall this place was a great meeting spot for a big group for a Birthday.  We had never been before so were not sure what to expect.   My two complaints are that the bathroom is ridiculously gross (but after a few beers, not so bad) but apparently I had more than a few beers...the tab for my husband and I was $80 which does not seem in line with the atmosphere and the disgusting bathroom.  I would go back but keep a closer watch on my tab next time.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 05.05.10  Don't ask me how I ended up here Cinco de Mayo with three boys.  I can't tell you even if I tried.  Neighborhood dive bar, good draft beer selection, red cup on beer = tapped out.  Very reasonably priced, which leads to more beer consumption than one should have on a Wednesday night.  Good times.

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: Not sure why some of these reviews refer to this place as a dive. I think that term is way over-used these days. This is definitely a neighborhood bar and a cool one at that. There's a pool table in the back and the locals seemed mellow. The bartender was low-key and quick. I liked the overall vibe and the beer selection was pretty solid.  If people want to try some real dive bars I got a few recommendations for them. In the mean time try not to describe any you bar you go to that isn't a lounge as a dive.

TWMn0oA1G00m1gDNOHMTOQ.review_text: I have to say, I used to come in here quite a bit back in the day. It used to be a great dive bar with a good crowd, friendly bartenders, in a great hood. And then I kind of stopped going....a year later I've come back and found a bar filled with douchey-mcfrat-boys. The vibe of the bar has completely changed. If I wanted to hang out in the Marina, I would. AKA. Not. Into. It. At. All.

qlJVwqTNPKDv91NOfi0k9A.review_text: low key dive bar.  it's dimly lit, kinda like a dungeon, and just how i like my bars.  people of all walks of life come around during happy hour.  you can't beat their happy hour deals!  they have a great selection of beers, and wines of all sorts.

brTYfgAc0uD7fiT8arLqIg.review_text: I rolled in here last night when my friend & I discovered that neither Absinthe nor Sugar were open at 1 AM on a Monday night.  (I mean, dude!)  I'm not sure what's up with people calling this a "dive," unless that means to them any bar with a pool table in it.  Comfy sofas (and plenty of space on 'em at 1 AM on a Monday, let me tell you!); good beers on tap (Racer 5; Black Butte Porter; Leffe (*swoon*); &c.); pleasant people working there.  Why have I not discovered this place before?  Hayes Valley suddenly looks so much more chill -- and I mean that only in the best way.

GZgM5M0O7NtLV8xSIjuIQw.review_text: I never really can remember the name of this place. In spite of this, my friends still know what I am referring to when I say let's meet up at that place Pascalls, Pagals, Place Piscalls.

MFZAJCjeogRcavL7pvU6yQ.review_text: Aside from smelling like au du lemon scented Lysol, this dive bar on Hayes isn't half bad!  Decent draft beer selection, and a pool table so one can only criticize so much.  Not sure if I'd hang out on the couches....

_lbgVbWTvxV9VTVWU0YnwA.review_text: Wow... what a dump - and I'm not saying because it's a dive bar, I'm saying it because of the crowd this bar keeps.  We came into this place on a random Sunday afternoon for a day drinking session after a mediocre breakfast at Stacks.  At first, we were having a great time: drinking beer, playing Foosball, and just lounging on one of the back sofas.  Well, shortly after a few rounds of kicking ass on the foosball table (as I normally do!) these guys kept bugging to play me.  So, I played - I lost.  Well, what do you expect?  I haven't played in quite some time and this dude looked like he plays all day every day at this bar!  So, after giving them the table, we went to the pool table.  The guys followed saying "oh, you think we're good at foosball, just watch us play pool!"  Look buddy, I don't give a $hit about how you play.  I'm here to hang out with my friends, not be harassed by some loser who hangs out here as if it were home.  So, after patiently waiting for our turn on the pool table, some chick runs over and starts racking the balls.  My boyfriends said "oh, that's my name as the next player on the chalkboard, actually." Instead gracefully apologizing and moving aside to wait her turn, she says - "WELL MY NAME WAS ON THERE BEFORE AND NOW ITS NOT."  So, what in the hell does that mean??? Instead of getting in an argument, my boyfriend says - ok no problem, I'll just wait and go next (he's so sweet!)  He leaves for the restroom and she starts laughing with the guy who was playing the last game.  So I guess they were friends and lying so they could squeeze another game in?  WTH?!  It's not that big of a deal people!  If you wanted to play again, you could have just said so - we didn't care that much,  LOSERS!  At the same moment my bf is walking to the restroom, some drunk lady with her dogs starts pointing at him saying "that's him, that's him!"  I look at her and asked her if there was something wrong (in a very nice manner) and she says "YEAH THAT GUY KICKED MY DOG AND LAUGHED!"  With a bit of a laugh that I really couldn't hold, I said WHAT?  No he didn't - when did he do that?  She said, oh maybe it wasn't him.  I said um, ok and walked away.  No need for a useless argument.  My boyfriend steps out of the bathroom and she runs to him "YOU KICKED MY DOG AND LAUGHED!! YOU KICKED MY DOG!!!" My boyfriend half laughs and asks WHAT???? When did I do that?  She says "LIKE AN HOUR AGO!" I then walk up because I'm not having any of this and say "LOOK LADY, WE JUST GOT HERE LESS THAN 30 MINUTES AGO AND HAVE BEEN IN THE BACK PLAYING FOOSBALL!"  Eventually she calmed the hell down and went back to her seat - but kept staring at us and talking about us with her friend.  Seriously, why are you even bringing your big ass dogs (YES MORE THAN ONE) to a bar anyway?  We are actually VERY pet friendly people but this was too much.    We finished our ONE beer and proceeded to the next bar without all the drama.  This place was WHACK!  Too bad for the bartender as well - we all work or have worked in the bar business and are great tippers.  Sorry your bar groupies sucks!

jX52sZoojxyYV2viWNyO7A.review_text: Place Pigalle, you're nothing like your Parisian namesake, except for the dirt and grunge.  I'd come here and order a few beers (really nice selection on tap) when I had nothing better to do... nice bonus: you can smoke inside, for those of you that smoke, that is.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text: compromised wid my fauxfemme Innes and went here first before we headed towards different 2nd parties and got a quickie. humm, cuties wid da grunge works for s'him too. that couch looks like one found on the street wid da um....large sticky stain?

FVWL31cQvOp3mO2fi5WlOA.review_text: I'd like the place even if it wasn't so close to my apartment. It's like being at home, what with all the beaten-up couches, except all nice and social. Their beer and wine selection is great, the bartenders are super friendly, and the pool and foosball keeps everyone entertained. Personally, I'm not a fan of the smoking that happens in the bar, but that's my only real complaint. It's a neighborhood place, not a destination location, and I always leave with a smile on my face. Oh, and they usually have jello shots on the weekend. Like I said, always a good time.

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: A nice, dark and cozy place to have drinks.  I love the great selection of beers on tap (including Racer 5 IPA, Hoegaarten, Bodingtons, etc).  They have something for everyone - that likes beer.  The couches were a real nice addition to the place.  As for those that don't drink beer, you're only options are wine and soju cocktails.  We went here on Saturday and encountered a very mellow crowd.  I can't wait until my next visit!

sCpQ4H_lKHXTLpo4rUu1RQ.review_text: I'm typically a fan of quirky dive bars, but this place misses for some reason.  Perhaps it was the broken traffic cone hanging from the gaping-covered hole in the roof which passes as a "skylight."  That being said, it provides the standard assortment of beers one finds at these sorts of places in SF (you know the ones).  The crowd was nicely mellow as well.  I would stop in for a drink if I'm in the area, but probably wouldn't stay that long.

sXLAy83l7EwdZjsYFbaq0A.review_text: Yay! I had a hot soda here (because they didn't have any ice!), and I probably got hepatitis upon entering that bathroom... naaaasty, nasty-ass bathroom. I give this place one star because the resident dog is cute, and the other star because I haven't seen a real Lite-Brite since I was a kid... yes, there was a community Lite-Brite for one's light-therapy needs.

o9Ez0unDH1XninHhs3h2Fw.review_text: Nice quiet dive bar in Hayes Valley. If in the area and looking for a casual place to hang out with your friends, I recommend Place Pigalle. Diverse beer selection, pool table, hooks under the bar. No complaints but nothing to write home about.

QOlY5FYliVVvkgqgtjdP_w.review_text: it has a little something for everyone: comfy couches, artwork, pool, foosball, etc.  my only caveat is that my clothes absolutely wreak of smoke the next day.  the bartenders are always super nice, and be sure to say hi to jackie -- she's always helping out over there (and is quite the pool shark).

MDmNN2laCuXHrfc04COMCQ.review_text: cool place to hang. this place serves lots of beer on tap, good choices of wine by the glass, soju and sake cocktails. there's obviously a bar with stools to sit at, but there are also couches and round tables.  they also allow dogs in here! that was funny! dogs at bars.. i have never experienced that b4 till last night. case in point, the shih tzu in the bar decided to roll up next to us on the couch. cute! went here after work one day and threw back a couple of blue moons. bartender gave me orange slices and said "this is how we do". yay!  they also played good music while i was there - a mixture of old school hip hop and a few red hot chili pepper songs.  i would have given it 5 stars, but someone had BO and the stank was wafting in and out of the place.

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: Ah, Place Pigalle. I've never been there for a non-birthday, but everyone has gotta be born sometime, & I've noticed that friends who go here for birthday parties tend to later make this their bar of choice for their own birthday party. It's spacious, unpretentious, centrally located, moderately priced, & you can smoke indoors there (a source of contention for some...okay, most). But smoking-quandary aside, this place is pretty sweet, & I'd go there anytime there's a birthday to meet up for.

hp4EfXvHbwFLyczlFz9WlQ.review_text: It's a tough town.  There are loads of pubs, but in neighborhoods afar, and there are loads of stylish over-priced scenes, but I'd rather stay home and watch the Warriors try to make the playoffs.   So it's hard to find what I'm looking for (which seemed so abundant back in grad school).  But if what you happen to be seeking is a low-key, comfortable place to grab a beer with your friends after dinner, or to chat with a date and actually hear what he or she has to say, Place Pigalle is a fine stop.  They've got a solid beer selection, though they don't have enough exotic ones on tap (particularly for a bar that focuses on beer and wine), and happened to be out of innocuous things like Stella.  But it was a really pleasant surprise to find a place that actually has sufficient seating.   I probably wouldn't go there to meet people you don't already know, but it's the first bar I've found in awhile in which I could enjoy a beer, and enjoy the good company of friends.  But maybe I just had a fun night out . . .

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: There are times when you don't know where life will take you. It's good to know there will always be a glass of cheap wine, comfortable couches, a dirty graffiti filled bathroom (my favorite, because it reminds me I don't live in Bergenfield, New Jersey and I sure as hell don't want to) and gigantic windows waiting for you here at Place Pigalle.

nd1Z0OCN5H6BaEr77HMLuA.review_text: It's gonna be very hard for me to write a review of this bar because of how my night started. yan was in town from prague, so a few of us went to a german restaurant called Suppenkuche to have dinner. the food there was pretty good and they had a ton of different beers to choose from that you could get in all sorts of sizes ranging from small glasses all the way up to huge *4 liter* containers. yes, you could definitely drink a serious amount of beer in this place. yan and kevin got a huge 2 liter beer that came in a monstrous glass that was shaped like a boot. it was hillarious. erica and i each got 1 liter beers. as the night wore on, we each got another order, so by the time we left the restaurant, we had each drank 2 liters a piece. we left Suppenkuche and stumbled off to Place Pigalle. the rest of the night is a bit of a blur. somehow i lost my debit card and also my paycheck. somehow i got into Popscene without paying. somehow we ended up being driven around in a Lincoln Towncar. somehow we ended up on some girl's balcony. the night ended at Sparky's, yet i dont recall anything about a very expensive milkshake, nor how we got home. ahh yes... another classic night. so, what does this review actually say about Place Pigalle? well, pretty much nothing really. all i know about that place is that it has a pool table and looks kind of run down inside... and i only know that cause i had to come back a few days later to pick up my missing debit card. ***edit*** ok, i've been back to place pigalle a bunch of times now.  i really dig the place and it's become my local bar of choice on many nights.  chill atmosphere, good beers, and they used to allow smoking inside which was really cool... but sadly, they can't allow it anymore. (my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: fiftybars.thisisvlad.com )

_wgezevSyzQiLuvaNlKJqA.review_text: Nice beers, shitty cheap wines, moderately disgusting bathroom. I do like the juke box though and the pool table is nice. This is the cheapest place in the hood with Marlena's gone,  $7 for 2buck chuck or whatever they pour there.

qD51vvp5Zf5DgPEGy7yfDQ.review_text: Place proved to be a good bar to continue our libations after hitting Suppenkuche.  And it's a cool spot to kick back and relax.  Smoking is allowed, but while the smoke didn't bother me, I can see it being a problem for some people.  The bar's a fine place to stop in if you find yourself in Hayes Valley.

LtVyiNyp26ikDf-aJULqzQ.review_text: I used to hate this place.  Why would I go to some straight dive artsy hipster bar when there are so many other places to go?  Then I found out why.  1. The bartenders remember me   2. The place is totally local (except on the weekends, you've been warned)  3. Cheap beer and reasonable wine  4. No meat market  Oh, and one of my BFF's practically lives in the bar.

Zqu-tMR9CHjA44sU7I5bXA.review_text: It's a good place to grab a beer for happy hour and chat with old friends. Definitely a dive-locals feel. The music is generally hip hop but I haven't seen anyone dancing. It seems like people just congregate here to throw back a couple of cold ones on some comfortable but worn couches.  They get points for having Chimay!  Smokers are welcome to smoke inside here. I'm not a smoker so I'm not too excited about that but, eh, whatever floats your boat.  Overall, I'd go here on a whim but not as a determined destination. It's good for what it is. A place to get a drink. Utilitarian.

WYJCG3mlZC_xePoDLxVCFQ.review_text: A couple of blocks from home or I probably would never have gone in.  It's a decent kinda-divey-but-not-really place.  I prefer a real dive.  I also prefer a full bar.  It is a good place to sit back and have a beer and be able to talk--a quality a lot of bars lack.  This makes me wonder: why are there so few good places to just chill over a drink?  Rock shows and headphones have pretty much made me incapable of being able to pick out voices in a loud environment, so I've gotta give some props there.  But it stays at three stars.

szhitaiKPsjC15bveyXRzA.review_text: WARNING: do not go to this dive bar wearing a suit.    I know, I know, I know, I should have taken the tie off before I walked in here (its not like I just stumbled in (well I did stumble since it was after a few)) but the point is that I walk up to the bar order my Chmay and sit down on the couch minding my own business when a local comes over to complain that I am bringing the vibe down by walking in with a suit on.  I look over at the dude who is clearly annoyed and probably thinks I drove an SUV and parked it outside and tell him I dont speak English.  I burst his bubble, he fell off his soap box but after a little back and forth he gave up, reached into his pocket pulled out a fifth of Jamos took a swig and offered me some.  So the lesson learned: DONT WALK INTO THIS PLACE WITH A SUIT UNLESS YOU CAN SPEAK ANOTHER LANGUAGE

deq1UGZFqd4mmb1b5-9qWw.review_text: I always end up crying here. Usually, it's my own fault for falling over or falling in love with someone. But last Friday, it was Place Pigalle's fault - they ran out of pint glasses at 11pm on Friday night. No back-up plan.  Boooo-hooooo.

8AKkzhyzq8UVzQ8WuGoFlA.review_text: I have a friend that lives just a couple doors down from here, so when I see him we normlly go here. It's a comfy place with couches and a pool table, good people, good times. It can get quite crowded on the weekend, so get there early to get a good spot

VPINiUt71jfnBkGcf-XX_A.review_text: They have Chimay on tap, and that's worth at least two stars.   Probably not going to hang out here all night, especially since they don't have hard booze and it can be misty with marlboro haze, but is a good place to grab a beer or a glass of wine.  I have to admit to not really getting the whole soju/sake cocktail thing, but I don't tend toward the sweet end of the cocktail spectrum.

Pgp3ujphDzRjYTGJFGnP8Q.review_text: My friend and I went to Pigalles Thursday St. Patricks Day, after not going there for a year. I was happy to see it open again because the neighborhood doesn't have many choices for bars.   Of course the lack of beer was annoying but I did find the new girl likable. Outside of being nice and on her first day, she was comfortable enough to engage my friend and I, and others, in conversation which I liked. Honestly we went back last night because of her service (nothing against the other bartenders who are good)...and are happy with her addition.   I do like the feel of a "down home" bar but the place really needs some focused attention on the decor without affecting the local or typical customer base. Hopefully good things are in store for this place.
