c9m5WYY6KysAtyo5-ngvYQ.review_text: No one has mentioned the Place Pigalle bartenders and they MAKE this place. I stop in to PP on my way home almost everyday. This is definitely a locals spot during the week. You can get to know your bartenders there and they aren't pushy like other "hipster" places where they just don't give a shit about your order. Daniel is super friendly (and from Boston) and always happy to listen. Everyone is really hot! I don't know what happened to Lindsay, she is a sweetheart, but Anthony is very cool and is a good story teller.  I love their foosball table and the fact that I can get a pitcher of beer and not have to deal with the smell of pot and cigarettes the way I sometimes do at zeitgeist. If only they did bloody marys...  I love that you can bring in your dog and there are always dog treats on the counter. The couches are comfy and the bathroom is...well, unique.  Cheers!

5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: I went here last night with a couple of courageous friends who were not afraid to hang out with me after a Yelp Elite event.  This should earn them a place in the Guinness Book of World Records because I was definitely feeling F-I-N-E!  As in "no pain" because I'd drunk my weight in alcoholic beverages.  I think Kevin actually attempted to engage me in some serious conversation regarding Salvador Dali and his place in the artistic world.  Now THAT'S goddamn commendable!  Several of my friends knew the bartender there and she hooked me up with a delightful glass of prosecco.  I love me some prosecco and I love me a place that appreciates serving it instead of some foul, cheap swill masquerading as sparkling wine.  Extra kudos to the two cute pooches snoozing on the sofa.

G1DM_OyYFb32QylgvQGrGQ.review_text: It's a dive bar with couches, lots of "found object" art, a huge back space that holds a pool table and more couches.  Seems like a lot of couples come here.  A nice retreat from window shopping, this dive serves only beer, some good jams, and has a friendly and upbeat vibe.

UuM7grHT7EKz3f2rF3wJVg.review_text: This wine  bar was  the perfect atmosphere of  lounging  around  and interesting artsy people  to talk to.  A little  too  smokey in the back but me and my friends sat near the door so we good  access to the fresh air.

6x3qPM172G0_Ba5jFlTwLA.review_text: This place is pretty laid back - there's nothing hard here, but if you like beer and smokey bars, check it out.

DiAUiaoDKFlifJK0FCkEWg.review_text: I am friendly with the bar tenders... I am friendly with the patrons, I wish i was friendly with Sancho, the resident alcoholic dog. He wears a bandanna and drinks all the beer he is given. This is a great little dive bar with foozball tables and the occasional competitions. They always have local artists have their work on display. They only server sake, wine, and beer. If you want well drinks you can walk on down to Marlena's and enjoy a drag show while your at it.

XHvfw3UU2YtvvKMLV_oWSg.review_text: Cool little dive bar-When we walked in they were playing Daft Punk- then continued on to play Notorious BIG, Decent selection of draft beers and a pool table in the back.

4ylPZeW-5QZhCD8yMztp8g.review_text: Again, this is another one of those situatutions where I'm surprised I'm even allowed within 50 yards of the premises.  I mean, the amount of jackassery I have performed here over the past 2 years of my life is unheard of.  But they actually enjoy it or at least pretend to and keep welcoming me me back in with open arms - thats the messed up thing!  Its a beautiful thing in my eyes and this is a beautiful dive bar.  The bartenders here are the best in the city - i cant say enough about how fucking awesome they all are.  This place is like a second home to me.  I love the neighborhood crowd - alot of the people i met here have become great friends.  Kind of like the abusive alcoholic family i never had.    Oh and i totally kicked so much ass at foosball here about 2 weeks ago - seriously i was on fire, you shoulda seen it

quFKdGPaL_JHdXwqwHNm4w.review_text: I came here a week or so ago and what everyone has said is true: pretty typical dive-y bar with an excellent and varied beer selection. The bar itself is fairly large, with multiple different seating/standing options. They don't take cards unless you hit a certain dollar amount (can't remember what exactly).  But it's key selling point, which not enough people have mentioned: DOGS. The night I came to this place, there were not one, not two, but THREE dogs running around and hanging out. They were the cutest.  If you're dog-deprived living in your tiny city apartment, it's great to get to go hang out with other people's dogs in a situation where you don't have to ask "do you mind if I pet your dog?" as you awkwardly lurch towards a dog on a leash.   So yeah, go here because you want your three different types of Allagash on tap for less than $6---stay here because you want to hang with the dogs!

MWoE80sT-6QU3hO2PBHGzg.review_text: When you first walk into Place Pigalle, you would think you're in the Haight or the Mission, not Hayes Valley. Not exactly known for having a series of no frills bars, Place Pigalle manages to solidify itself as the neighborhood's bona fide dive.   Nice by dive bar standards, it's definitely the place to hangout for the locals who just need a place to grab a beer, shoot some pool, and hang out when they don't feel like dropping some serious coin at one of the many fancy restaurants and bars that are scattered around the neighborhood.  This place is definitely "what you see is what you get." When you walk in, you'll find a few small tables and seats, as well as a small bar. They only serve beer, wine, and sake, so if you need some hard liquor, you'd best be going elsewhere. Thankfully, their beer selection is top notch, featuring over 20 domestic, import, and micro brew beers on tap. Good news for the beer drinkers out there, you can order anything on tap by the pitcher. They also have plenty of bottled beers, including one of my personal favorites, Chimay. Check out the full review on my blog, see profile.

Ip8ztdExo0hy_ErKr9WoNQ.review_text: I love this place. super chill, great beer and ambiance.  It has become one of my favorite places to hang out on a weekend or happy hour.

60BRzMurKxXAkp798XtC7A.review_text: Chill little dive bar with a really good beer selection and bartender!  My friends and I were exploring this neighborhood a couple Saturdays ago  and stumbled in here for a few beers.  We aren't exactly hipsters, and yes we are older than most of the people in here, but we were made to feel totally welcome here by the bartender.  He recommended beers to us and let us try a couple before we decided which to order.  I'm probably twice his age but he was super relaxed and friendly with us.  Not like, "Why are you people in this bar?"  lol  Will definitely drop in again when I'm in the area.

8NVYA1Jbp4Wj70g_WdCXAg.review_text: For you elitists out there, consider this: Every time you write a gripe and call it a review, you are doing a disservice to not only the business, it is also to the staff that relies on tips. To Kate K, you went into a bar that on it's yelp review says beer and wine only and expected vodka, then gave 1 star to the establishment, which to me speaks to your integrity. Do you have an agenda with Place Pigalle? You evidently drink beer, you're holding one in your profile picture and there is another photo of you and a Tecate on the beach. You state that you "can't respect a bar that doesn't serve vodka. That and it smells like foot..." did you go in on one of the nights when we had huge downpours and the whole town smells like foot because of the dampness? How did the bartender treat you, were the drinks cold? Was the pool table functioning? These are the things of a review, yours is a rant. So next time you want to up your review count, do us all a favor, you elitists, write a real review. And when you're called out on your poor writing skills don't respond with "It's just a fucking Yelp review, relax." no it is not just that or you wouldn't be writing hundreds of reviews. And for the people that work in these places and feel the hit from these poor excuses of a review , it's not just a fucking review.

KcHGO-5qw03HYjtk5k3CzA.review_text: It's a decent beer/wine dive-y bar.  I certainly don't know how to rank it (or others like it) in the Canon of SF Dive Bars, but it's fine.  Nice place to grab a beer.

bPLL3tqfwBrRX0K5dwgONw.review_text: You can't smoke in here anymore so what's the point.

CgHbSPnkpCBn-EJkwJeghA.review_text: When you want to get everyone out of your house and grab some pitchers o'beer, where do you go? PLACE Pigalle (or da pig as we have called it from the get go)!  This is just the perfect neighborhood bar in terms of convenience and the fact that I actually like it.  The staff is mellow, I know each one by name as they do me - hey that's gotta count for something, right?  It does in my book!  I've met some interesting folks here too, some I'd like to forget and others I don't remember.  But the real reason we starting posting up at Da Pig is for their foosball!  Boy is it a fun game especially when you are not very good but love it just the same.    I suppose my tagline could be "When the going get tough I go to da pig"!

SMfq-__aZWg_YEWhrgwgFQ.review_text: This place is great for sitting with friends. If you can snag one of the tables (esp. in the back), the music isn't too loud that you can all talk and enjoy their selection of beers and wines. I've had a lot of fun here and the bartenders are great.  In Hayes Valley? Definitely stop by and get a pint or two!

v8ipAh_tNQovfD5LcaDlKw.review_text: This place has the can-can do spirit of dive bars.  After I'm done shopping for 200 dollar vegan shoes for my dog at one of the Hayes Valley boutiques, I like to come here. This bar is really a neighborhood watering hole.  This is usually a good place to find a pool game or meet a friend for a drink. I like the style of the furniture. The art on the wall changes often.   This place isn't too much fun when it's crowded. There is only one bathroom and you can wait a while to play pool. Drink service seems to scale well with the amount of people though.

oQhZez4nAwXH0kutnpULfg.review_text: Chill hole-in-a-wall bar with a good selection of beers on draft. Beware of your belongings because there are some suspect bums in this area.  Once we had to slap a bum for reaching into my friend's bag!

mW8fvDQ3JAtzeLjU--CjTg.review_text: Came by with a birthday group last week and thought it was a nice place. Nothing special, but it's not pretentious at all  and the drink prices are reasonable. Got the Bourbon Barrel Stout, which was delicious.

o24hAvq77K5csF5z4UbURg.review_text: I go here for happy hour alot cause my co-workers pick it alot.  If it were up to me, I would pick other places in Hayes Valley.  But, its got a lot of space, cheap happy hour, good location. so I don't complain that much.

CFL1vDhDfriHesGPJX09tg.review_text: I've been dragged to this place twice now and can't say it's my favorite. The name is also incredibly misleading. The only similarity between Place Pigalle in Paris and this place is that both are messy and dirty. Like Place Pigalle, in my year living in Paris, I only managed to visit there twice. It was fun taking pictures in front of the Moulin Rouge and yuccking it up but at the end of the day, like the bar, there were places I liked a lot more than Place Pigalle.  The beer selection is pretty good--there's some 15 or so beers on tap. I slugged through my allagash white and the boyfriend liked his west coast IPA and our trooper of a third wheel Colbert T. said his anchor steam was just fine. My beer was kinda tepid--I enjoy a good frosty glass or at least the beer cold and Place Pigalle doesn't offer that.   There's a bunch of couches that are great for sitting but also, in my opinion, kind of dirty. Not my cup of tea but not the worst place to be dragged on a slow Friday night. It was super packed which made for some good hipster watching. It took me a second to realize I had been there before but for a very dead happy hour.

7A5lajj4qvHSDM97Kg-x4g.review_text: Good place for a drink and a game of pool while you're waiting for your people to collect. Every time I've been there (about twice a year for the past few), they've been playing good mixes and the crowd has been hipster but pleasant. Great beer and good wine selection.

HdW_VZSVFiZTt7VcGIu52w.review_text: there's nothing parisian or sexy about place pigalle. it's actually a dark and smoky bar with a pool table. i see a whole lot of hipsters here trying to get in touch with their rougher side, but please, we all know the hipsters aren't very tough at all. if the hipsters were indeed tough, they would walk up a few blocks to the low income housing on hayes street in the middle of the night.  one recommendation. don't wear your good clothes here, unless you don't mind smelling like my dad who happens to be a chain smoker. oh, and if you're a regular here, i suggest that you check your lung regularly. yes, even if you don't smoke, second hand smoking is alive and well at place pigalle. now if you don't mind the smoking, place pigalle is a decent place to hang out, drink and shoot pool. if there's a waiting list for the pool table, that's ok. just start playing anyway. if the hipsters get mad, let them get mad. i mean, they're just hipsters. it's not like they can fight or anything.  * i think this is my most macho review to date. i kinda like it. or not.

KeZjKwMbqPU2qQO7oGgWLw.review_text:
Your standard arty neighborhood bar. Good selection of beer, lots of seating, local artwork and a pool table. Last time I went there on a Saturday they closed at midnight?
  One thing that can be gross is the smoking inside. I sat at the bar and when I crossed my legs something fell from underneath - makeshift ashtrays filled with cigarette butts. Yup, all over my legs and purse. Yyyyeeck!

YGvtTweRXu-fcjaNRVJALw.review_text: This place is a blemish on the face of San Francisco. We sat at the bar for a solid ten minutes- not to even be acknowledged by the way too desperately hipster lackey bartender, so after being very obviously (and purposefully) ignored we left. There was all of seven patrons at the bar- not even remotely busy. Dirty, horrible decor, bad lighting, deafening jukebox and abysmal service- or lack thereof in this case. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere- there are many other bars in the immediate area that will welcome your business.

_StgklibYb1J2IJOaPMJqg.review_text: Daniel is the BEST bartender.  He's really nice and always has a smile on his face.  My friends and I used to come here weekly about a year ago and when we stop in sporadically, he still remembers our names and what we want.  I also like that there are often dogs in here.   Great bar, great jams, great prices and good people.

A0_AQYOXtytaRbl-yHcpaw.review_text: Great neighborhood bar with a babe working behind the counter! Decent beer selection and some wine too. nice and dark with a pool table juke box. best part is it hasn't been over run by suits...

v6BwXWTmUyRKYch-pnzAiw.review_text: Johnny Pyle!!! Yum Yum dive bar  It's raw,  it's got a hot layout,  it's in perfect neighborhood.

C469FeAyiATdaNmgXjZYWQ.review_text: Divy and good. Get my magnars fix here. Will come back and reevaluate when it's busier. Got a pool table in back and ample standing room.

1R25AVXTD2sQgNNN6z0PFg.review_text: Low key, roomy place with a large selection of beers on tap.  Good happy hour  (I believe its $2.75 per pint) and close to lots of tasty eats In Hayes Valley if you get the beer munchies.

fQuLe-KuojSco4DRbcFpGw.review_text: this is a 4 star dive bar.  DIVE, being the operative word.   it's grimy, unpretentious, jolly drunks meet downtrodden sales execs clearly done kissing ass for the day. it's a good place to unwind and relax. i love their music mixes, cool bartenders, and foosball and pool table tourneys.  they have a beer and wine license only, but they have hot/cold sake and soju. i wouldn't recommend this place to non-smokers, as it's impossible to come out of there not smelling like an ashtray.  it's in a great neighborhood and decent parking. check it out if you're looking for an easy getaway from cover charges and dress-to-impress places. good people, good vibe all around.

3tJcTVPckkv7ZOrn1EcqPg.review_text: Place Pigalle is a go-to spot for friendly bartenders, good beer, and decent prices.  The happy hour is especially welcoming in that regard.  Don't expect a chill, scenestery, bar.  To me this place defines what a good bar should be:  The music is always loud, there often a lot of pretty drunk people, there's comfy seating, and there are lots of smokers on the curb.  Maybe it's not everyone's scene, but I like having it in my neighborhood.  Oh yeah, and we share initials!

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: I went here to get a beer while waiting for a friend (Biergarten was packed) so we could go to Loving Cup/Schulzie's Bread Pudding for dessert.  One beer turned into five and we never made it to dessert.  Oops.  Had a great time.  The bartender was friendly and attentive, it wasn't loud, they had good beers on tap, and it wasn't difficult to find a place to sit and hang out. Doesn't hurt that they're next to Timbuktu and there's a bike corral nearby.

YlJNqoHqIssCHP25h2sUFA.review_text: Am I in Paris....I've been to Pigalle, but this doesn't look like it...there aren't enough hookers around!  But it is a great bar.  Nestled in the thick of Hayes Valley, this is a dive bar with "class" (if such a thing exists).  Comfortable couches, pool tables...and friendly clientele.  I've heard you can smoke here which gets the one star mark off....luckily the night I was here there was no smoking.  Definitely will check it out again as it's close to home!

zEarwErejqXmDol-gGXDkA.review_text: A grungy Bohemian hipster joint, with a French twist. The bar has some old couches to sit on and some interesting local art on the walls.  Place Pigalle has an interesting selection of beer and some good wines by the glass (be aware that beer and wine is ALL they serve; no liquor on the menu).  They also look the other way if you want to smoke... but if smoke bothers you, you should probably go somewhere else.

eRHBKd719ydDbH6n37wAcQ.review_text: Go ahead, prop yourself up on a red velvet sofa!  Not a bad little dive if ya ask me.  They have Blue Moon here on tap...SWEET!  It smells a little like Clorox when you walk in, but it goes away with time as you start to feel a little high from the fumes.  :o)  Just kidding!  Three red couches adorn the entrance where a good group of people can chill-ax and talk.  There's also a nice sized round table that can easily seat 6 people at the front.  The bar is suuuuuuper long so you should have no problem finding a place to sit your badunka dunk.  Pool tables are located in the back (and yes I said tables...I think there were two maybe three).  Myself and three other peeps walked in here on a Sunday evening to grab a pint after putting our name in at Patxi's across the street (also reviewed).  This is a great place to just hang back and enjoy the evening.

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: Love the couches / plethora of seating options.   Cheap drinks.  Interesting music/ decor combo.  Fun place to lounge around with friends, but probably not where you want to end your night.

3OtmrtS2sXiBHUQ1m6owCQ.review_text: Dark, comfy bars with pool tables always work for me. It's not Paris like the name implies- but there's a touch of bohemia and i guess, euro flavor, what with all the smoke... Nice bartenders, nice priced drinks!

DTWtZJAIPMrZJwUJV0DJmQ.review_text: Shatangi was brought to Place Pigalle by out-of-towners who had been there on a previous trip.  A great mix of mostly trendy but very laid back and unpretentious 20-30 somethings in a bring-your-dog and smoke cigarettes, hipster SF kinda way.  Pleasant staff and good music.  Shatangi told you...

_XFhTYX3wS0ftGc9u4pLqw.review_text: I love this place! It has a Foosball table, a pool table, funky couches, cheap drinks, lots of space, and great music. Seriously.  It's a very chill bar.  Only downside is the grungy bathroom, but it makes me feel like more of a hipster for frequenting this bar.

rX96zl-3HodtewDdiFzhgw.review_text: this place is okay.  but kind of only because hayes valley severely lacks a just easy go-to bar.  this place could be it, but not in its present incarnation.  1.  get a real liquor license.  i'm sure this is much more complicated than i am making it out to be, but it'd seriously up the awesomeness.    2.  be a little nicer.  i get it, you're going for the hipster-don't-give-a-shit thing, but when you're kind of a dick to my friend's girlfriend and no one in the group can figure out why (and she's like the last person you could imagine being a dick to, just a really nice person) it kind of really sucks.  this was last fall; i've been back there a few times since then and the dude in comment hasn't been around so hey maybe it's bygones.    i kind of like this place, and really want to like it more.

V2NgfYGt3mYFVVyYMoWbFA.review_text: My new neighborhood bar. Cool atmosphere, lotsa beers, pool, foosball, lotsa beers. Also always a few dogs running around. Allows smoking which can be a huge plus or minus depending.

e9tRaGle0R48BOaIgEZMyA.review_text: Want some alone time with a date or is the result of a crappy day at work forcing you to seek isolation...with good beer?Well if that isn't enough of a vague description than use the excuse "the weather is simply shitty!". Regardless this is the place to go. They have a good beer selection and quite the atmosphere to make for a fun destination. Parking is quite the challenge but as my most of my reviews are proving, parking sucks in San Francisco.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: It seems as if this bar lounge has been through a lot over the years.  It looks run down, but offers the standard seating area as well a full bar and one unisex restroom.  I couldn't tell if the door to the restroom was closed or occupied because when you lock it, the door is left slightly opened and not closed entirely.  Besides that, there is a pool table to entertain and an open area that reminded me of a dimly lit dining room.  I've just seen better bars and been to better ones, however.

3TXNWQ-x98YphuVy2HegJA.review_text: Nice random place I came to with Kevin and Ajay this past Thursday after work. I was amazed at how large the space was, especially in the back. When I came, the back was completely empty, including the pool table. My friends and I decided to play a bit of pool. A drunk, much older, gentleman came by and decided he wanted to hang out with us. I guess that was okay but he kept touching us, mainly Kevin, then Ajay. They joked that he wasn't into me, but you know what, I'm not complaining!  Beers were nice and cheap(er) than other places in the area. They have this special $9 beer that you should take a sample sip of. The boys convinced me to try it, saying, "It smells like ass, but tastes really good!" It wasn't too bad. Just don't smell, haha.  I feel like the bar would have a much nicer feel to it if the furniture in the back was arranged in some better way. Maybe get someone in to feng shui it? It did feel a bit recreation-room-like (as someone stated in a previous review).

PAuzCcKBzwRkiQhdqS0ftA.review_text: Sweet neighborhood bar.  Good atmosphere, great lighting and cheap drinks.  Not  a pick-up joint, not a sceney trend zone.  Just a great place to have a drink with a friend and relax.

56vERWd2VPTfjytCQlSc6g.review_text: Great day bar spot (think hole in the wall type), especially to drop your boyfriend off at while you go shopping.  Pool, darts, foozball and comfy couches keep you entertained, really sweet girl behind the bar.

-vss4j7XXTWUWyKV2gWlNw.review_text: It was a good suprirse; dive bars can be that way sometimes...and being SF; it's not uncommon for that little touch of something to make it more than just a dive bar

6p3bSON7IBTS4AG4IFZG8w.review_text: Great bar, I like to go here often, though not as often as I would like. right up there with Lone Palms for me.

ZvtIMylao3fzsiT2G8AJ3A.review_text: Wandered in here while waiting for a table at Patxi's with my ball and chain. I appreciated the low-key vibe and the vast selection of beers. I actually didn't realize it was beer and wine only until coming to yelp to write my review -- good thing I had wanted beer that night! If I had ordered a cocktail and been refused, this review would probably look a lot different.  I enjoyed the sofa-seating... there's something magical about sitting on a sofa and drinking beer... in public.

OnMRLZ5Qalb01iMjyL80Ew.review_text: The good: -Not one, but *two* Tornado tables that are kept in good condition. -Foosball tournaments -Big open windows at the front -Hoegaarden on tap  The bad: -Smoking inside (YUCK!)

uYs60IPTrCFXOrq7dUq0_g.review_text: I love this little spot named after Picasso's old stomping ground. I started coming here when I moved to the area last year and can't break the habit. The bartenders are the best and there are always friendly dogs hanging out with great people.  It's a beer and wine joint but its not uncommon to see people grab shots at Marlena's a block away and stumble back for more. You can even sip on business juice after work and keep on going with the recent addition of free WiFi.

8JabhfiPNpyTLV2pYDBrDA.review_text: YAY, pretty cool place to chill with great music.  its a very neighborly atmosphere and casually "funkdafied".

w55vztPPofeXLhKJLSMeGg.review_text: So bummed to hear about Hayes valley Prop. Trying to shut down this neighborhood bar! This place has been here for years and it's always been a huge contribution with the neighborhood, they support local artists and are great people. If there's a petition let me know, I'll sign it!

2Sf58ceaNru-RFabRtUvvA.review_text: Dive bar? Really. Ok. It's awfully nice for a dive bar.   3 dollar Racer 5 pints at happy hour make me happy. Friendly bartenders, and interesting seating are nice too. They have a decent selection of beer on tap, and some decent look wine choices (and that's why it's NOT a dive bar!). They also have sake.   Nice little spot in an area of the city I don't frequent, but if you're in the area, it's a nice place to grab a drink.

Z4n5CnqKECsNWT5oJTNsMQ.review_text: Read the reviews for Place Pigalle and you'll get a sense of the great atmosphere, awesome selection of beer and wine, wonderful local art and fun bar games. What doesn't come through enough is how nice and truly inviting the people that work there are.  We recently hosted a party for my wife's birthday at Place Pigalle. When we arrived we were greeted by Terry, the bar manager, and Samantha who helped serve our party. Terry was a gem, making sure we had everything we needed and helping us to get everything setup. Samantha worked her ass off. I mean seriously, she was amazing. She always had a smile and no one ever had to ask twice for anything, which was a tremendous feet considering we were about 40 at the high point. I honestly don't know how she did it.  If you're looking for a chill place to unwind (solo or with friends) Place Pigalle is hands down the best spot in Hayes Valley and one of the city's best!

lJmQg9UC_J8UGxmtd-Pi2A.review_text: I think I may have found my go-to bar. After months of San Francisco bar-hopping Ive found a bar whose vibe I just get. It feels comfy and friendly- from the bartenders to the regulars to the couches on the side of the room. Best on a low key weeknight. Solid and reasonably priced beer selection. Pool tables in the back. No muss, no fuss, just a good solid bar. Good choice for those of us who inhabit that ambiguous zone between hipsters and yuppies.

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: can you still smoke inside here?if so thats where my two stars come from.other than that, its not that cool of a spot.

XnFbxNCucA_IWQY3hkDOJg.review_text: I am still on the fence about Place Pigalle so, for now, they get three stars. I don't really understand hipsters and so I feel slightly out of place but the bar staff always treats me well and they have a good selection of beer. You might see me here at the bar with a wrap from Hayes & Kebab or a "thin crust" pizza from Patxi's.

2xLEMsSeCSsk8hnfw_bg1w.review_text: great beer and wine selection, no hard alcohol, not open early enough (not til 5), good mellow vibe, smoking is a plus, especially when the bf smokes and doesn't have to go outside every 15 minutes.

wZ13br0UIvwn_txbZ1vRvg.review_text: After dinner at Domo and a quick pass by Smuggler's Cove,  (who would wait in line early on a Friday night to go to a tiki bar?) we head back to Hayes and stop by Place Pigalle.  We had been here once before during the day and it was average, close to the apt. and had an inviting couch up front by the window. Well this time the couch was full and bad music was blaring and the crowd was a yucky combo of post work late 30's, 100% anglo drunk desperation.   It was not average.   It sucked. It could have been me.  I have a high standards for bars, divey or not, I like my crowd mixed, my music either great or nondescript and the majority of the patrons have to be collarless.   Though there is a death of bars in Hayes Valley I wont be back. Plus when I walk by Into Video to and from and I think about my 140 dollar late fees and I feel guilty.

GXn4ZsasLKh0qZ5g3nIqcQ.review_text: Not exactly the place you'd think you'd find a smoking bar, but sure enough, there one is. Amidst all the closed little posh Hayes Valley shops lies this smoking bar. It's like the little rich kid who's parents don't know he's off having cigarettes during study hall. I love it. Good beer on tap, pool tables and an interesting atmosphere. It seemed like a designated couples bar, as if you couldn't come in unless you were swooning over someone. Cool bar, I just have absolutely no idea when I'll be back over in this direction...

D0ty0wxjQLhQR9GjhMSLXA.review_text: I'm a little late to the train, but one of my new favorites. I walked by this place for ages before I actually decided to go inside. It's very much a place to chill with your friends, or significant other than trying to pick up people. Props for the comfy couches, and their happy hour, the darker atmosphere makes for a nice date bar.    I don't know if it's the namesake, but every time I go I seem to run into the staff who work at the french school down the way (and the owners of cafe tartine), and they're perfectly happy to let me bum cigarettes from them in an attempt to actually have people to speak French with. The downside is I'm a little sad that I never came during the time in which smoking inside was allowed...Le sigh.

VQoFQ8225ZeSplagU0nE4g.review_text: Love the atmosphere: dark, relaxed with a great selection of beer and wine.  My only complaint is that sometimes it's SOOO LOUD YOU CAN'T HEAR YOURSELF THINK!

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: Place Pigalle is the red light district in Paris. When I'm old and rich I'm going to move to Paris and open a bar called 'Capp Street' and it'll be off the hook.  Despite the name, this spot struck me as unpretentious and fun. beer & wine only (which is fine with me; the crowds at these places tend to be much less obnoxious), a few pool & foosball tables, loud music. The bartender on thursday night was cool enough to down a shot of soju with us and let me slide a little on the $10 minimum for credit cards (Please don't abuse this.) I'm gonna come back.  There is only one bathroom here for both genders. There is often a line. This is the only reason this isn't a five star spot, in my opinion.  And while the soju isn't particularly strong by itself, it carries some bad hoodoo. We found ourselves wandering up the embarcadero at 5:00 the next morning and I think those shots had something to do with it somehow.

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: if you want to slum it in a hayes valley bar, this is the place to go.  not a full service bar but has a very relax atmosphere.

KeZmfAGKpXJhhEt6j8kZjw.review_text: I really enjoy this bar, especially at happy hour with a group of friends. It's a relaxed atmosphere, nice and laid back, with some interesting local art displayed. The smoking is a drawback though, but it doesn't seem to get that bad....

xnlVxgrLP5HgaKZobRuHZA.review_text: Hello, my new neighborhood dive bar, good to meet you. Living and playing around Hayes Valley, Place Pigalle has become the bar to go to when we're waiting for a table to open up at a nearby restaurant, when we're meeting people on the way to some event, or when we just need to go get a beer.   I'll admit it's not the NICEST of bars, but what neighborhood dive bar would be? They have a huge variety of imported beers, local beers, and a lot of beers on tap. They also have wine on tap (When asked how that works--Is it pressurized? Can't be, right?--the bartender replied "I don't know the SCIENCE behind it, I know it just works.) The wine it limited, just red and white blends, but I get it embarrassingly often, considering all the awesome beers here.  They don't keeps tabs and they don't take credit cards for orders less than $12. There are pool tables in the back but I've never played because I'm intimidated by the riff raff that's always back there. Also, this place is dog friendly, so bring the pooch.

q4yMVuGp1JZW1n2eSleEvw.review_text: On the expensive side for a dive bar, but with a pool table and a good amount of seating and some good beer choices.  Yes, I will be going back.  In fact I'm kind of shocked that it took me so long to go there in the first place.

CKE7bImVY81KJD8PiiuDPQ.review_text: Great Happy Hour! Interesting array of beers on tap too. I liked it!

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: upscale dive vibe with plenty of seating - thank you SF god - & nice beer selection + pool table. unexpectedly down to earth for this part of hayes ;)

Ad9CVmXNegnsfYZWBYKoxw.review_text: This bar has become one of our favorites. The beer selection gets an A+ with all of their high content of delicious alcohol :) (I really need to get back to my AA meetings after this place) I highly recomend their choices of Ipas. I still havent had the opportunity to make it to one of their happy hrs. Yet I'm still willing to spend 6 bucks for a decent pour of beer here. Only reason I don't give it 5 stars is due to the lack of food. Other than that I highly recommend trying out this place.

BiRLsPNxF7Do5H6j9NYPdg.review_text: A good chill spot that's great for hanging out with friends. Not much going on in the way of decor but it's a dive bar, so who cares. Laid-back vibe with the customers and the bartenders. The bartender has a lovely black dog that's very calm and friendly, we petted him all night. But he tends to break wind when relaxed. Large dogs make large smells! You've been warned. Pluses: nice selection of craft beers on tap, prices reasonable, large space with plenty of seating, pool table in back.

3uWP6jEI099DTgtRxFU2cA.review_text: Living in Hayes Valley, I have to walk by this place almost daily. The stench of stale beer permeates the sidewalk from 10 feet away. The sofas are literally full of fleas! The bathroom is disgusting, the toilet doesn't even work half the time. The only plus this place has is a friendly and responsive bar staff. If you can manage to go in and sit at the bar, get your drink and get out, you'll do okay.

e2prQn9FpEaeLkEKT0A30A.review_text: When I'm in town, sometimes I'll drop by here with my best friend for a beer or two. I like the music they play...I heard an MF Doom song once..surprise.   The restroom is a no go...unless you really really gotta go.

Bc_hZIB-Yhorc1ZjLYZKOQ.review_text: I went here once with my crazy ex-roommate and she somehow managed to spill beer in her eye.  I love you Place Pigalle- you made my year!

zAxVTy0LH5QHxEQfzpk3sg.review_text: Nice chill spot I found after getting off work early.It was raining outside and I was waiting for the bus,so ducked in.Good beer selection..10 on tap,and a few bottled. Allagash Curieux! Pool table,tv with the game on,open space in back with couches. And they allow dogs,very cool! I will def be back in with my lab,and def be back after work,especially if it is raining and I don't have my bike.No bike=more beers.

oOE6GdVb_4aTC2oufln8WQ.review_text: Years ago I worked for a company that decided to name all it's conference rooms after places loved by the senior staff, one of which was Place Pigalle. Now being that I worked for a Medical Device Company I thought of Place Pigalle as some stuffy high-end bar, the likes of which my four-inch heels would never see the inside of.   I was wrong on both accounts.   I have been to Place Pigalle several times - last night being the most recent. It is dark, a little dirty, and the music was way to loud. However, they have a pool table and a decent selection of beer, wine, and even sake, which is a nice offering. I don't think they serve anything 'harder'.  The place seems to attract a very local crowd, so it gets 'stars' for that..especially since I feel like all of my standard places in the Mission have been invaded by the under 25 crowd. Plus, the bartender was really cute (if you are reading this I was the girl in yellow and the guy I was with is NOT my boyfriend). An extra star for the eye candy.   Still, I can't imagine my former group of senior staffers visiting this place since it was full of greasy-haired tight jeans wearing boys who were bopping along to the Janet Jackson that was blaring out of the stereo. Come to think of it maybe that conference room was named after the 'red-light' district in Paris. Ewww, gross! Dirty bastards.  If I was in the area I would go back, but no special trips.

MizlaDrXhL99TrWWXXkO5Q.review_text: The couches are nice. It makes me feel like I'm in my living room. Except for all the beer stains...and cigarette smoke...oh, and I probably can't take off my pants.

QocP49nZ7Fo-4Rp_QxPuDQ.review_text: I was pleased to see the big red couches are still here..fyi like carousing in your living room but instead in a bar!

2iVXoaHBKlQPEtMkwaQvpQ.review_text: Cool psuedo-dive bar in Hayes Valley. They've got a great beer selection, and enough little nooks and craney's to allow you and your 7 other friends to all hang and socialize.  There's a foosball and pool table too, in case the conversations get dry. Because of its location, and the way Hayes Valley has become very up and coming, you can get a good mix of people here.  I'd recommend it for anyone who wanted to "get their drink on" in this part of San Fran. Its probably not half bad for random socializing either, as most of the people popping in there are from the neighborhood.

1ajfyNyf41CxS8doHEzmfw.review_text:
great feel of this place, and a wide array of beer to choose from. deep in wine, sake, and soju too. definitely a locals bar where regulars are plentiful and outsiders can feel a bit like the nudist at the wedding dinner. pool table, foosball, and pretty damn big for a local spot.
  if you smoke, youll love it here, if not, you may end up leaving after just a few minutes. if i lived in the neighborhood, id be at this spot all the time.
  oh, and dogs are welcome, kick ass.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: Place Pigalle in Paris has a nice representation of three things I like a lot, or so I have been told and so history dictates.   This is the location of Moulin Rouge and countless sex shops. If a little TB, a few whips and dildos as well as some side alley prostitution don't scare you then this area represents sex, and I, personally, like sex (though as a disclaimer I must say I am not a huge fan of TB nor side alley prostitutes who, in times past, were proud carriers of the TB).  This area is said to carry some of the best musical instrument shops in the world. Now, this doesn't help me much since, aside from some brief success with the Violin that I wasn't motivated enough to pursue, I am a complete wreck at playing any instrument. However, I like music and admire greatly anyone who can master an instrument.   Place Pigalle was once also home to the studios of many of the Modern Art Masters; Toulouse-Lautrec, Picasso, Van Gogh all painted here to name just a few, and if you know anything about me you know I would cut my left ear off to own something by any of these artists.   So, Place Pigalle, the little bar in Hayes Valley, has a lot to live up to.   Yes, they have music, but it has never struck me as mindblowingly good, its just there drowning out the chatter of a mellow crowd of beer and wine drinkers (No hard alcohol here).   They have artwork, which is constantly rotating, but I have yet to see any pieces that have inspired me to even trim a fingernail for, let alone cut off an appendage.   They have sex. Oh, wait, not they don't. In fact the only logical place for a quickie in any bar would be the restroom, and since the entire damn bar has to share one single bathroom sex is most definitely out.   Sorry Place Pigalle, I know you try hard and you are okay to pop into for a beer, but the name is all wrong. I think you ought to leave this one to the French.

uMIppVwGLc8oYKkvtqndGQ.review_text: Open Letter to Whomever It Applies:  You slam Pigalle and complain that you should be able to go to a bar that serves drinks you like to drink.  Well, guess what?  You are.  Jade Bar is right in the 'hood and Marlena's is just a few doors down.  How is it the fault of the bartender or the establishment that you chose to stay and drink beer you don't care for in lieu of the hard stuff?   Pigalle is a great neighborhood beer and wine bar with incredible bartenders and colorful patrons but, clearly, it's not for everyone.  Thus said, might I suggest that, should you again find yourself in a similar situation, you save your time, money and vitriol and just leave.  It's a big, big City.

JJIJImbqqXXH6sk93yH7hw.review_text: I liked it here.  Wasn't too busy when we were there, okay selection of beers for okay prices. It has a darn good wine list for a dive bar.

aEKUC4oQg2CokbwyW_CXSg.review_text: I like this place. Hipster feel, great tunes, good vibe. If they had liquor I'd come more often, but good spot for a glass of wine or a brewski!

OqlcSakW1xxCBONdE9Mwlg.review_text: good selection of beer, but can anyone tell me why the music is ALWAYS so loud?

GSA18YuTR5Eb84Asb_wK1w.review_text: I came here with a large group of friends.  At first, I thought the place was small, because there seemed to be a lot of people crowded around the front. However, once I moved through the crowd, there was a back room with a pool table and many couches. Good for groups of people.  This bar has a great selection of beers and wines and a friendly bartender who joked with us about moving the furniture around. Would definitely recommend.

9hu2xk15wtF6Lh1H4xGBdw.review_text: Eff this bar.  On Thursday 05/15/08, I opened a tab at this bar.  The tab was opened to purchase 2 beers. Upon leaving the bar, I forgot to close my tab. I called the next day and asked if I could wait to close it for a few days, to which they agreed.  On Monday 05/19/08, I came to the bar to close my tab. They told me their card reader was down, so I paid cash for the bill, including a hefty tip since they had obliged me in letting me close the tab 4 days late.  Today I look at my bank account and see that they decided to run my tab WHICH I ALREADY PAID IN CASH. They also decided to tip themselves a generous 8 DOLLARS!!!! which seems a wee bit high for a tab that was $9.50.  So, I've basically paid 33 dollars for two beers at this POS dive.  Eff 'em.  Greedy bitches!!!!!!!

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: When I'm looking for professional drunks, this is where I go. It's not that bad, really, but I think some of the people who hang out here like to at least pose as such.

G8iMlPG06HfxoXXSpX3vYw.review_text: Aw man. I remember the good old days when I lived at Eddy and Laguna, gun shots popping off daily, living with the female version of The Dude with an unfortunate and uncontrollable rage disorder...   It was such a quick stroll down to Hayes St to grab one of many yummy on tap beers here. It was always the favorite go-to spot on the way home if I wasn't quite trashed enough and needed a few more beers to finish off the night.  But of course, some lurker had to creep into the picture and crap all over my sweet spot.   The place has just the right mix of toothless daytime drunks and hipster kids chaffing their balls with their tight tight pants so you always have tomething fun to look at, and laid back neighborhood types to offer some palatable happy hour company. But unfortunately  it turned into dank and musty cavern harboring would-be date rapists and leg humpers.  Ugh. Tell me why a girl cannot go into a dive bar in the middle of the afternoon by herself without being chatted up by the most desperate and socially awkward guy in the place.   I mean admittedly one night I was that girl with a long trail of toilet paper flying freely off my shoe after breaking the seal in the unisex pisshole placed unfortunately in pool cue range, and maybe I did take a quick second to nibble at a hang nail that was bothering me all day, but that does not give your pit-stained and greasy self permission to get all up in my personal space, make a drunken yet failed attempt at eye contact, and try to whisper in my ear that you really like nail biters. Especially when I happen to be on a date at the time. Gross.  And tell me why said awkarkd guy has to be there each and every time I went back in hoping to make equally intrusive and unenjoyable conversation with me regardless of whether or not I was there with someone else. FOR THE NEXT TWO MONTHS.  Ew. And that was just the worst of them. For some reason Place Pigalle attracted more than their fair share of creepers. And these creepers just can't get enough of me when I'm two beers deep and grinning uncontrollably with that post-work warm belly fulla beer feeling.   No I'm not flirting with you, I'm trying to get drunk... Lay off chester.  So until that dude finds a new place to socially infect I'm staying away.   But I'll miss you Place Pigalle, you and your yummy beer, furry dogs, and pleasant service. I'll always keep a little piece of you with me.

prXdLYDt5ZFE4pG03Z9N0A.review_text: The bartenders were friendly, service was fast, they have a pool table and a good selection of cheap to good beer. The only downside was that some clown bumped into me and then acted like it was my fault, but I didn't let that ruin an otherwise pleasant experience.  They allow dogs too, which is pretty cool I guess.

Vgh-CjwAl4tFleP39OdzaA.review_text: $9 pitchers? Word. Pool table & Foodball table? Yes! Large bar, a lot of seating & chill vibe. In a great location (need food? Paxti's is across the street). It's all you really need in a bar. Will return fo sho.

29X3khrCfdHbFz0JNdY6-g.review_text: Place Pigalle is my go-to local watering hole and I spend an embarrassing amount of time here.  it has my full endorsement as a neighborhood bar, nasty-ass bathroom (it's a hover situation, ladies) notwithstanding.    during the week the scene is local and low-key; come here on the weekend, and you're spinning the roulette.  bartenders are friendly, the selection of beer and wine (only) is excellent (Leffe on tap!) and the happy hour is great (the $3 house wine isn't some crappy Cabernet-Merlot blend but whatever they have open and need to get rid of -- make sure you ask).    there's a ton of space, too, all rec-room style with assorted tables and couches, so it's great for those nights when you've been hiving for weeks and want to invite everyone you know out (and they might all actually show up, possibly with everyone they know.)  oh, and s'il vous plait, people, it's not "plAYs" but "plAHs."  you know, like the red light district in Paris.  yep, THAT Pigalle ("PEE-gall," even.)

epIp3mfCqrtGGsKAcbsdBg.review_text: Probably my initial go-to bar in the area. Great selection of pints...and the service can be quirky in the positive sense ;-)

H4k1YJ6Aqpv9yfk9EQlorw.review_text: Place Pigalle was my jam when I used to live in the neighborhood!  I was lucky enough to stop in for a trip down memory lane when I was last visiting San Francisco.    I'm not sure what else one could ask for in a San Francisco dive bar.  This place has lots of seating.  Tons of beers on tap and even hard cider for those of us who don't care for beer.   They have a pool table as well as a nice couch area in the front right near the windows. Perfect for some Hayes Valley people watching!

7nUIDRxi7o50agPP3Wo1FA.review_text:
Thank goodness for old places like Place Pigalle in Hayes Valley.  
  The neighborhood sure has changed in the past ten years, and it's all good really.  It's still nice to see the old haunts remain open and rough around the edges. 
  Place Pigalle is dirty in an indie-brit-boy-rocker type of way. . .you know, it works and is sort of attractive even though they could stand a good wash!  
  Pool table in the back, art on the walls, smoking okay (but doesn't get too smoky) if that's your thing.  A good place for a drink and conversation.  This is a very laid back place and I like it.  
  Beer and wine only.

ca0N3Fl3FckAWyupp6sDgQ.review_text: This bar has a cool feel and an interesting crowd, but the fact that patrons are allowed to smoke definitely takes its toll on you after some time (brought back memories of the late 80s when I used to go to clubs and bars before the anti-smoking law was passed).  The drinks were a bit pricey, and it's too bad that they only serve beer and wine (although they have a pretty good selection of beer).  The smoke is what keeps this review at two stars. If the bar were smoke-free I'd be dropping 3-4 stars on this place. Of course, if you like to smoke this place would definitely work for you!

KCaOZUnCx25FJhFr_lKsEg.review_text: Okay place. I'm a fan of Allagash White on tap, and the comfy couches in the back.

3KqBf9avm_5e9wwodmudvQ.review_text: This beer snob approves of the tap selection. They have quite a few beers on tap. Nothing too crazy but lately they have been dabbling in sours, saisons, and some obscure beers. Tasty coconut porter, Maui Brewing I believe, and the elusive Moose Drool, which isn't really elusive but not too many bars in the city have it on tap. Pool table, small bar area, couches and a nice open back area with couches in every corner. Not one bad thing to say about this hipster haven and it's a few blocks from my work! Hooray for beer!

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: I've been here twice, one time it was nearly empty. I like the music, back room and comfortable seating, the staff was nice to us and there was a dog lazing on the floor, probably my #1 barometer for a bar's awesomeness is if there are dogs allowed. Then we went back, it was crowded, everyone was smoking, girls were dancing on the bar (I think they work there too). So, it was too Coyote Ugly for me. Also, I'm pretty sure half this bar ends up next door to my house dancing to some crappy techno until 6am every other weekend.

gjZp61JZaqcLrKjEDVSPIQ.review_text: Easily one of my favorite spots for a drink.  It's a good conversation place because you can actually hear.  It's dark in a good way.  They have artwork and couches for lounging.

H5zNEMUfGMRE6O51hHoirw.review_text: I love this place as a neighborhood bar.  Yes, it's a bit smoky, but being from Ohio, I'm used to that.  I love the pool/darts/foosball atmosphere, and I always meet interesting people here.  There are certainly some regulars, especially the happy hour crowd, but there are always some people there for the first time, too.  The pool table is not quite level, and the cues aren't straight, but the competition is only semi-serious, anyway.  It's a great place to just put your name on the chalkboard and then chat with everyone in line to play.  Time passes, beer flows, good times are had by all.  I've been here at least a dozen times, and never a bad experience.

MSkN2ieSx3uu6WH728KriA.review_text: Great little dive bar in Hayes Valley. Foosball, pool and a great selection of beer. The bathroom (yes singular) is kinda funky, but is to be expected in this type of bar. Definitely recommend!

kS0_x2hYMot2MWE80TB0cA.review_text: Casual, divey, and close to home. 3 things that are essential for a bar I want to hang out at. Place Pigalle is all of those things.   As you walk in, that yummy smell of beer overwhelms your nostrils, and your eyes get drawn to the free (YES FREE) pool table in the room just past the bar.   Wooden cafe tables and chairs line the walls in the front room, with some cozy group seating by the windows. Tables, upholstered ottomans, vintage chests and couches fill the back room -- reminiscent of your friends basement in high school. PLUS they play the best tunes in town. I don't know how they do it, but their shuffle on that old school jukebox of theirs is ON POINT.   If you're looking for somewhere comfortable, affordable, and easy -- do yourself a favor, and go here.

KUtiiZtdY9ofO4ejDKWK6A.review_text: They held on to my phone & had a good chuckle when I had to ask behind which bar my phone was being held.  Mighty human!

oAz4s21FA2QjE0kCNIDxOg.review_text: Not sure if I'm quite "hip" enough for Place Pigalle, but I do appreciate the foosball and pool tables. Makes it a nice, chill place to hang out. I think I'd be a little more into it if they had more than beer and wine, but hey, I can make a little vino into quite a night out!

2uM3O9Qy4vxvITAfke7_4g.review_text: A good dive-bar with a nice selection of beer and a Fussball table!  Nice loungey-area, good for groups. Spacious, yet not too big.   All of these things combined are just a guarantee for a fun night.  I love Hayes Valley, so many fun bars to choose from on any given night.

dJAoG82CBmiKc3Nb2YfQdw.review_text: The lack of hard liquor is a bummer ... it's almost made up by the fact you can order pitchers and smoke. At least you used to be able to, you can't smoke there any more (for now)  Damn ... well, at least it's cozy and gritty at the same time.

XMb6fW9oGXTXl1b15wGoBw.review_text: This place is great in my book. Beer and wine only, but they have a cool laid back vibe, and there were cute dogs running around. love it. the bartender is super nice, and drinks are cheap for the most part. Cool spot to hang out.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Nice tap selection at this oddly named bar. Couches and pool!

GMiMXVIv9y5gpF95WCBZEQ.review_text: It's smells funny and it's loud! There is also a resident crazy who apparently hangs out there.   Seriously,  how did I get stuck talking to the CRAZY? She claimed to be a ex hooker, actress, healer, producer, band manager................. She also liked to drink a lot and take off her clothes. Oh, yeah she did! Definitely ruined it for me.  **************Update ****************** One more star for a fab birthday for Lisel and free jello shots! ****But, the bathroom is one Hot, Stinky MESS!

4rscUhRnHPie0Uv3VEcoOQ.review_text: Super cozy, great tunes, drink specials, beer/wine to everyone's liking, dogs chillin', people chillin', happy bartenders, happy patrons, great area, all sorts of people walkin' in/out - diverse in age/culture and drum roll, please...  One of the most memorable bar bathrooms in San Francisco.

J5rxPAMYjlpuKoCcC_z47Q.review_text: Stopped by during a one hour wait for dinner at the nearby Suppenkuche.  It wasn't ultra crowded for a Friday night at 7, and there was plenty of seating for our party of 10. Interesting art work, Lots of comfy couches, and a good selection of beers. Nice people working there, and there's a pool table too!  I'm a little surprised that this is classified as a dive bar too! It looks way too nice!

B7wbZOogh9FbxLv-hK2I4A.review_text: I love dive bars, but this one rubbed me the wrong way.  I felt it had bad energy and a weird vibe to it.  Despite it being a Fri night there was only one person seeming to be working.  Took forever to get drinks.  The front area is semi-comfy.  The back area has a weird divey-yet-sterile feel to it.  Old grungy couches which are nice, but uncomfortable little stools.  And while I usually love light, the skylight makes the grunginess look strangely sterile or austere. The place made me anxious and I will never be back.

NDdAkv3Ygc30PcPw7zg5kQ.review_text: Minus the star for having only one bathroom. Miss Bartender was a. great to look at and b. totally sweet.  Mr. Bartender who took the next shift (no, I was not there all day, simply happened to be there at the time of the shift change. no really!)  ...Mr. Bartender was rockin his ipod over the bar speakers and made my night with new rockin tunes for my out of touch ears.  It's been a long while, Place P, but you did right by me this weekend.  The perfect combination of rockin out, having a conversation I can hear, drinking 'a couple' of glasses of wine, and if I got the notion, I could have shown you how much of a badass I am at pool.

Z2PISdtGHThSUUbFccGkrA.review_text: An unbeatable happy hour in a relaxing and spacious bar with sofas, couches, tables, billiards, and more.  Let me start with their happy hour - it goes on from 4pm - 7pm and draft beers are $3.  Racer 5 IPA is your best bet here if you enjoy a good beer.  "P.P" would be my "go-to" bar if I lived in the area, no doubt.  I really like the non-pretentious crowd, too.  I have yet to experience the place during the wee hours of the night, but I'm certainly a fan.  Let the romance begin!

ksRHD3gWsQGuK_r9GT-xKQ.review_text: A cool dive bar. Good selection of beers on tap, lots of seating. Good if you have lots of friends, also the free pool table is pretty cool. However its pretty loud if you try to hold a conversation. Prices are good.   If i was in the neighborhood again i guess i'd come back but i wouldn't go out of my way. In general, the place is ok.

iI5hC_uNUBGkkvtWrBIaZQ.review_text: I kind of want to give this place a bad review so that I can have it all to myself.  But, I have to be honest and say this may be my new unknown happy hour spot.    This is a fun "dive bar" with a very fun happy hour (this may actually be on the edge of the dive bar category since due to the nicer area and Hayes Valley crowd).  It is very spacious and you can sit down in privacy with all of your friends.  The happy hour is M-F 4-7pm with $3-$3.50 pints and $3 wine... and of course the PBR pints are $2 (but they are normally cheap @ $2.75).  All the pints here are very "fresh" as the kegs are not old or stale.  They have a great selection of beers and you can sip on it while hustling people in foosball and pool.

E_9WOCYIGHtT2nbcY4_t4w.review_text: Good casual spot for beer or wine.  Foosball and pool, plenty of couches. However, one star off for no hard liquor and only one single stall bathroom, for men and women -- there's always a line.  Dogs running around -- nice!  Not so nice: Drunks dropping a full glass of beer on the ground, staring as it spilled, then continuing to play foosball.

MF6Cpfd-NexbRNyaIo_DVw.review_text: trully....what makes the place for me....is the convinience since the neighborhood has so many sheeshy yuppie bars....this bar is the only relaxed one.....and the service.....Daniel the bartender is great....He's always very nice....and no....not nice cause he just wants you to buy rounds like many bars in the city, doesn't throw attitude...he's just nice....he can actually have a cool descent conversation with you.....Well....what else can you say about the bar....? I ONLY GO there ON WKDAYS...

RyWKKwLzLSWi_8bZd1QWYQ.review_text: Although when I first went to Place Pigalle, I was haten on it right off the bat - because of smoke.  I still can get frustrated with the amount of smoke, but I still for some reason still make my way back.     One thing that helps is that they keep their foosball table in great shape - nothing like having fun playing a bit of foose.  They even have tournaments every other Wednesdays.    One other thing I really like about this bar is the consistant quality of the music being played.  There usually is a variety of reggae, soul, hip-hop, ect - and always something I enjoy nodding my head.    They only have beer, wine, soju - and the prices are a bit more than other bars, but hey - it's Hayes Valley, what do you expect?  Wish I could give it 3.5 stars based on the prices and smoke, but still think it deserves better than 3 stars.

38zhUVIh6t_-mpcmbWYmiw.review_text: Good place to come to if you want to feel like you're in Europe. The dark atmosphere, smokey room and candles give the place a great spooky feel. Drinks aren't anything special here, but it's a nice place to start off.

FlwHQJ_xfEE2yut2g1RX4Q.review_text: Hands down, one of my favorite little bars in SF and its only beer and wine! Great selection and awesome bar keeps.. friendly local family vibe. Cheers!

fS9vRXSmi6IW8ULnUMgrFw.review_text: This place is definitely my favorite bar in Hayes Valley. I got to know the bartenders ( daniel- my favorite) and you will have an amazing time. They have couches, pool table and it is just a nice place to kick back at. Not at all fancy. You can just walk in and start drinking. And if I remember tuesdays are- Jello Shots. Unfortunately you can not smoke indoors no more, you have to walk out. Although, the bar is great. Good music, good people, good atmosphere.

_HVQorAvXWMwJ0cxwDp7Zg.review_text: My neighborhood dive bar! Beer and wine only, so makes for a more mellow drinking night than cheapass vodka cranberries at my other fav bar in the Haight. But, they have many extremely comfy couches scattered throughout. I was there on Halloween night at 11pm, and it was full, but not packed. Just the way I like it!  Music can run the gamut depending on who's bartending. I've heard neo-soul/R&B and hard rock on different days of the week. Keeps you on your toes though.

4W1D-dUW7bC_CJYgslzUqA.review_text: It's fine, I guess. Sufficiently chill, decent place to burn a little time enjoyably. Majority of clientele got hit with the ugly stick. Hard.

OZKtRnaNCIHuc44hgnzfNA.review_text: Has a lot of potential, but it's way too loud all the time. The crowd doesn't seem to appreciate or benefit from the music being so loud either. Even when there are only 3-5 couples in the entire bar, they're blasting music to a point where you have to scream to each other (while the sun is still out no less).  A tad too filthy for me to call my regular dive bar.

eXt9426w2kE65rUMhKb4Cg.review_text: Reasons I like Place: Smoke inside. Two pool Tables FOOSEBALL TABLE (although competition is tough) Big and roomy. Good price on drinks.  Reasons I DON'T like Place: One co-ed bathroom with a line around the corner.   Drafty and chilly at times. Fooseball challengers are TOO DAMN GOOD!

fsSqdAkSK2Zgx-Pcey1yOA.review_text: when french people say "pas mal" (not bad) they mean that something kind of sucks but not enough to offend them so much as to actually say that it sucks. that's kind of my impression of this place. it's average enough to neither offend nor arouse. and a good bar should arouse. if you see me walking around in a bar with full-on pants-tentage, you know it's a worthy spot.   the bartender seemed to be into the music, which is kind of cool but meant that he was occasionally AWOL because he was messing with the music.   1 star for accepting a credit card. 1 star for not forcibly ejecting me when my "date" (dear god that was a mistake) knocked over an almost full glass of red wine, both breaking the glass and spilling all over the place, and loudly proclaimed "i don't give a fuck" repeatedly rather than say, apologizing, or attempting to clean it up.   this incident caused me to seriously consider j-date for the first time in my life.

TnqdV1STYPdj7BgBzECJ4A.review_text: My friends and I stumbled upon this spot, and immediately wanted to go in.  This is a Just Right bar.  Tidy and interesting, not expensive, good variety of beer, plenty of spots to sit, nice crowd of friendlies, and clean-enough bathroom (other reviews suggest this might have been mere luck).  If you find yourself needing something to take the edge off the week, stop in.

lOMM7HTHhabi1qofd-w7zw.review_text: It took me years to really enjoy a good beer. I always liked my mixed drinks, and was a snob for a good martini, but a beer, that takes a palate in my opinion like wine. You have to weed out all of the piss water and really get to the good stuff. Leffe blonde, Chimay red label (or blue as well), Newcastle brown, and a good Hefe. Place Pigalle offers a variety on tap, minus the Newcastle, but tonight they were out of my three top picks, which left me with nothing too exciting to choose from. This didn't help me, for the fact that I was going to be enjoying my marginal fourth choice beer on a couch with a rip in the middle, where I couldn't even seen my feet it was so dark. I was lost in a midst of hipsters in hoodies, dirty cons and bad thick rimmed glasses. Instead of being trapped in a Gap ad, I felt like I was standing next to one of the most recent covers of Adbusters, where a hipster, classically dressed in the garb described above graced the cover. Offering their recycled clothing options as fresh and new instead of the regurgitated used clothing fronting as "underground" that it really is. Nothing beats American Apparel, Parliaments, and PBR, right guys!!!!  Don't get me wrong now, I do like myself a good dirty dive bar here and there. My bartender was great, and my bro I was kickin' it with made me laugh my ass of, of course, otherwise I wouldn't have two stars up in those boxes above. For a local night, pool and a few beers wouldn't be too bad, but the back space where it's located along with some foose ball isn't really personal at all. It's almost like the back of my high school gym where we hung at theatre class in between production set changes.   The major bonus of the evening was when I got hungry at an unmentionable hour, I was able to walk right out the door and go down the street to Absinthe, where Brad, my wonderfully helpful manager, was there smiling to greet me, and feed my sorry ass. All dressed up and no where to go.

ZrsryCGYEQfkhLyXXsP_EA.review_text: I have lived nearby and loved it for oh sooo long. (Too long perhaps?)  The owner has LET IT GO.  I was shocked when the health inspector came in and let sooo much slip by.  The bathroom is constantly foul and filthy.  More often than not these days they are out of most of their beers and wines.  (Empty or covered taps are the saddest sight a person can see.)   The only plus: the bartenders are all pretty good: friendly, making the best of a crappy situation.

KM5eYS2_77ECMfoncjIB4g.review_text: Great atmosphere, free pool table?! Kind and helpful people. Tristan really helped me feel welcomed and helped me find the right drink for me. It made a big difference in my day and my over all experience. Thanx Trisran!

tGkfSO_bRpXsSI1JYv1wQQ.review_text: Okay, let's pretend that the REAL way to rate a bar is based on two merits: the strength-price ratio of the drinks and how cute the patrons are.  Since Place Pigalle doesn't serve hard alcohol (liquor) here, the strength factor is out.  They do, however, have a pretty excellent selection of beer priced happily in a way I do not understand.  I used to be a picky beer drinker, but after making myself broke, I have begun to drink PBRs exclusively.  So $9 pitcher of PBR?  Good in my book for a cheap date.  How cute the patrons are?  Let's start with the bartenders.  Little blonde Lindsay is the CUTEST thing in the world.  Also a great dancer.  The Friday and Saturday night crowds bring in a good mix of yuppie/hipster, but mostly coupled up cuties.  Not sure what's going on with that.  Maybe it's the neighborhood.  The regulars are not attractive (myself included), so don't bother any other night of the week.  Still, Place Pigalle is awesome because it's my neighborhood "dive" and everyone there is my friend [after a few drinks]!

MWVvKb3-u-AWlXobkb4i-g.review_text: If I'm hanging out at Place Pigalle, it's because someone dragged me here. The only charm this place ever held for me was that for a while it was an unofficial smoking refuge, but now that the flame's been put out, there's no reason I'd ever choose to go here on my own.  Meh. Now if I can only convince my friends that this place is as lame as I think it is...

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: I feel like every time I come here I am in some dilapidated (sp?) house.  The floors are fucked up, the chairs are always strewn about the room and there is a motley assortment of people hanging out.  You would think that for a guy like me that would be great right?  I mean, I can smoke here too. Fuck!  The problem is that this is a little too much of a locals place.  You don't get service unless you are here EVERYDAY.  I mean, I know, those people keep the lights on but do the bar keeps really need to stand there and talk to their buddies for 10 minutes while I stand 6 feet away waiting for a beer?  Really?  Also, every time I come here at least 50% of the taps don't work or are out.  For a beer and wine spot this is just ridiculous.

ym91NK9QMPDU2g00zEuLIg.review_text: Cool place right in the heart of Hayes Valley.  Came here with a large group for an after work happy hour and space was most certainly not an issue.  Would return!

ZM3Y7pPuKu67Q_FOLqGx7A.review_text: I'm so glad I live just a stone's throw from this joint. My only gruff with he spot is not hard booze. BUT, that's a good thing also for nights when I say " Let's go get a beer" and that's all that happens. Otherwise, a beer would turn in to a beer then a mass of Jamies and soda. Then comes the stumbles and the yelling and the thrown of whatever is not too heavy to lift or bolted to the ground. Good times!

3X8nPqq5b-VItOiWdn73jw.review_text: Like your favorite pair of boxers or that tshirt you've worn so much it has holes.  One of my favorite places to frequent for a few pints, if not my favorite when the time is right. The people, the beer and tornado tables - keeping the fun alive.

6tgKc3hK1qi1l3SFE1DTug.review_text: $3 jello shots on Saturday nights...  I think it was the jello shot that put me over the top this weekend. So tasty. So evil. Sunday morning was painful.  It was a friend's birthday that night and we were having a girl's night out. After dinner nearby, we headed to Jade--too crowded. We headed to Sugar--too crowded. Dammit. We just want to drink!  One of the girls used to live in the neighborhood so she took us to Place Pigalle. It was pretty dead for a Saturday night. Then again, it's probably hard to fill such a big bar. It was perfect for us though since we took up almost half the bar. We stayed for a few rounds before heading out to Rickshaw Stop. I never knew about this place but it's nice to know there is a bar where you can easily get a drink and within walking distance to so many other places. I'd come back but I don't see it becoming a regular place for me.

5_gbaJzM9w_oAvLf7ARBWA.review_text: The bar substitute for your best friend's basement, replete with second hand couches and free pool table. The only exception is the beer is colder and costs you moneys.   BEER:  Good, nice selection on taps, and $2 Tecate's during happy hour.   ENVIRONMENT:  As stated above, super chill. The best thing is probably the  pool table, which is free. Watch out for sharks though, there are regulars who come through exclusively to whoop on young whipper snappers.  Lots of room in the back, nice during the day,they have a frosted skylight which brings in a lot of light to the area.

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: cool divey bar. good beer, decent wines by the glass, good people-watching.

1adKO0SWcnUGi54jBTSc0w.review_text: It is what it is. Nothing too special. Solid selection of beers. A place you start your night at.

5pBi1CSpm9467jh7PSBDkA.review_text: First impression, bartender was sorta a weenie.  He didn't seem very polite and had a "I'm too cool to even work here" attitude.  We got some sake which was nice.  It's my good friends local bar so I'll end up here again I'm sure.  Just didn't seem like much was going on.  Tad boring.

zF_unBFpdWMY6el-B7wO8A.review_text: I agree with other reviews, this is a chill neighborhood bar with comfy seating. To me it's always been my go-to location for meet ups with friends before dining. However, I've experienced several nights here talking late into the night with friends. It provides a nice atmosphere with often times interesting artwork, a cool pool table and nice bartenders.

rDTr5r0xEMpQpkPphe66KQ.review_text: Went here last night.  Big mistake.  They play their bullshit electronica so goddamn loud it gives you a headache; forget about having a conversation.  We, being everyone at the bar, ask the guy tending bar to turn it down.    This DoucheTard goes the cdplayer, and turns the knob .5 degrees counterclockwise!  We keep asking and he pretends that it's a huge inconvenience.  Half a degree at a time.  Well done fuckers.    (I couldn't wait to write this)

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: One star...you can smoke inside (i dont love this always, but every once in a while its cool)  two stars... its a great place to have a birthday party.  Ive been to a few, and with the comfy couches it makes for a great social time.  three stars...no one ever gets way too sloppy cuz of shots of booze, cuz its just beer, wine and soju  four stars...pool table.  always a plus  could have a fifth star if it had more than one bathroom

rNbX2MdVf07a37YKNezAcQ.review_text: I love this bar, and it has more to do with close proximity to my apt. Free foosball and a pool table, what else could you want from a local dive bar? Decent prices, friendly bar staff, great ambiance.

LahgT0Dec0B6NSws7VHiJQ.review_text: Racer 5 IPA?             Check. Foosball Table?             Check. Free Wireless Internet?            Check!  Really...what more could a man ask for? Ok...well maybe some tacos or a cheesesteak...but  Place Pigalle was still pretty awesome.  Decent music, down to earth people & comfy furniture make this spot top notch. If I lived in the neighborhood, this place would definitely be a haunt of mine.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: Three and a half stars, but only because I was only here for one drink. I was killing time before dinner, and since all the effing shops in HV close at SEVEN, I needed some way to kill that time.  A drink sounded ideal, so I parked myself at an empty barstool at Place Pigalle. Of course, being a solo drinker, I immediately attracted the attention of Lonely, Alone At The Bar Guy.  We chatted a bit about things far too intimate to have shared with someone you've known for seven minutes, I drank my $7.50 Chimay, and I left. The music was awesome, the bartender was sweet and I really liked the space.  It looks smallish up front, but there is a large back room with pool tables and foosball and stuff. I saw folks have food delivered too, which is always a plus if the place doesn't have a kitchen.   As for the smoking, I don't know if something has changed, but all the hipsters I spotted were smoking out front, and not inside. I'd definitely come back and give it another shot for more than one spendy beer.

oyalAv5PbFc4czFuxdEspg.review_text: i agree with ash a. it should be good.. they have wide selection of beer/wine, pool, comfy sofas, and i like it when the bartender brings his dog. but i dunno man, it has no SOUL.  every single time i go there i wonder why i keep making the same mistake. i've never made it past one beer.

tSKGejZuR8E7OGLckX4-8Q.review_text: It's NOT 'divey' - OK? Really, it's not.   It IS sort if like partying circa 6th grade getting drunk in your friend's parents house. Setting: the basement rec room, dirty poofy couches everywhere outnumber the kids, games, and no hard stuff just beer and wine. You are learning to drink. Boys on one side girls on the other. Occasional overhead lighting.  Pluses are big space and mostly dark. Chill on weeknights and sometimes good music. Oh, it's relatively intimate as well. So plus 3.     Sometimes they don't have orange slices for blue moon, or play crappy music....  Minus 3 stars for no liquor and "divey" reputation (faux faux faux. don't believe. do not)

582iTyqKkoHeBFPMJuQEJw.review_text: I really don't know what I was thinking when i gave it four stars.  It is as if the bar was made for me...well at at least the part of me that wants just a chill bar with no frills, with good music, beer, and opportunity to talk with the people you're with.  They have a great beer selection.  Leffes and Chimays were the orders of my last night...  It is as if I brought in my own playlist every time I'm there...seriously who makes these playlists?  I'm starting to think I may be blacking out and doing their music and then come home because it is so on point.  Any bar who puts out the Pharcyde, Quannum, Tribe, and Poets of Rhythm in an hour span has earned my money...  Foosball and a decent pool table.  Fucking foosball.  Pitchers.  Couches..couches...and more couches.  Thus allowing one to get uber comfortable as if the two of you were were just getting as trashed in your own living room...cue in occasional inappropriate PDA.   Seriously 5 stars.  Actually a head above 500 Club and The Page for my favorite bar...thank goodness it is within stumbling distance...just barely!

bAMtsU124oLgeAgi3gMNig.review_text: I live so close to Place Pigalle that I can fall through the door and into bed.   The beer selection is good. Playing pool at place pigalle is the best because there's a wide range of players from suckers to league hustlers.  The people who come here are mixed. The regulars are nice, the hayes valley shopping squad can get annoying. They are almost always there and typically have gone out of their way to drive to my neighborhood to spend money. I guess I should be grateful; Better than crackheads.   The music is almost always too loud but the bartenders are so nice I never tell them.

VEOD6Y-w1UoRnxzJZjTI1g.review_text: Beer & wine only.  No spirits or mixed drinks. They have a nice pear ale for gluten free folks, nice and tangy and sweet.  Pool table and couch in the back.    A bit funky but a nice place to hang out with a group.

hdQddcET45ejf7UMYQr2cg.review_text: They have cheap PBR, and uh, that's about their only saving grace.  I hate to give places bad reviews, but man, yuppie-city and only soju cocktails/no hard liquor? There's no excuse in this day and age to be serving soju in an alleged "bar" in the city.  Sorry folks, just not my cup o' tea.

p-rz5nElTuSyUV1Dzui6Yg.review_text: Not knowing where I was setting out to meet my friends, I found the place and discovered I've been here once before and liked it.   Its a good dark place to meet. Its a great place if you smoke because you can smoke inside. I suspect though that if it got really crowded with smokers I wouldn't be so blase about it.  The happy hour drinks are a good deal and the bartender was a nice guy. I also found some of the patrons there to be really nice people.  You can play pool in the back where its better lit.   I plan to drink there again.

36LgEtwt6ROhrCtuPjfRmQ.review_text: This used to be my neighborhood bar (before I moved). It's a great place to chill with friends or meet the neighbors.  There's a pool table and lots of room to lounge on all the comfy, ratty couches. LOVE the couches... Last time I checked you could still smoke inside. There's no hard liquor only beer, wine and sake.  It's dark and can get noisy and busy the later it gets, but it's still comfortable.   You're usually guaranteed to run into someone you know.  It doesn't cater to a particular crowd, just folks from the 'hood.

kjpkYNKTOOcmvMDKkZsO1Q.review_text: Nice vibe coming from this place. I came here randomly with a group of friends on a Sunday afternoon. The bartender is odd, the art work awesome, bathroom clean.  I'd come back if I were in the area.
